name: Kero-kero house room 1
description:
We have been in airbnb since 2011 and it has given us many new opportunity to meet and learn everyday.
It is a private room with a toilet just beside the room.

This is a house that owned by us Kotaro, Kei and Miya
It is 3 story house. 2 Toilets 1 Shower/bathroom.
Vending machine in front our house manage by us.

We have now in airbnb experience.
If you are interested in making bento and gyoza please let us know so we can send you the link for booking.



Thank you very much.

name: 4F Spacious Apartment in Shinjuku / Shibuya Tokyo
description: NEWLY RENOVATED property entirely for you & your travel companions, located in the vibrant neighborhood of Hatagaya, 3 minutes on train or 15 minutes walking to Shinjuku. Easy access to Shibuya / Shinjuku & fits up to 6 guests. The calendar is always up to date. The apartment has 40+ sq mts / 450+ sq ft, 2 bedrooms, 1 living/dining room. Simply put: it's TWICE as big as most apartments in central Tokyo and features ADSL Wifi, 2 HVACs ( 1 per room), washing machine, shower room and a kitchenette.
view: 4F Spacious Apartment in Shinjuku / Shibuya TokyoNEWLY RENOVATED property entirely for you & your travel companions, located in the vibrant neighborhood of Hatagaya, 3 minutes on train or 15 minutes walking to Shinjuku. Easy access to Shibuya / Shinjuku & fits up to 6 guests. The calendar is always up to date. The apartment has 40+ sq mts / 450+ sq ft, 2 bedrooms, 1 living/dining room. Simply put: it's TWICE as big as most apartments in central Tokyo and features ADSL Wifi, 2 HVACs ( 1 per room), washing machine, shower room and a kitchenette.
neighborhood_overview:
Hatagaya is a great neighborhood located 4 minutes by train train from Shinjuku (15-20 minutes walking).
It is extremely lively by any international standards but not as crowded a Shinjuku.
It features dozens of family restaurants, convenience stores and bars open 24X7.

name: 5 mins Shibuya Cat modern sunny  Shimokita
description:
Hi there, I am Wakana and I live with my two friendly cats.
I designed and built a house 11 years ago.
I am a business freelancer and one of my business is a real estate agent, so if you are looking for properties in Japan, I can be of a help!

My house is located near Ikenoue station, 5 minutes from Shibuya by Inokashira line. 12 mins walk to Shimokitazawa, hipster neighborhood.

If you have time, it would be nice to have a chat or go out for a drink.
view:
5 mins Shibuya Cat modern sunny ShimokitaHi there, I am Wakana and I live with my two friendly cats.
I designed and built a house 11 years ago.
I am a business freelancer and one of my business is a real estate agent, so if you are looking for properties in Japan, I can be of a help!

My house is located near Ikenoue station, 5 minutes from Shibuya by Inokashira line. 12 mins walk to Shimokitazawa, hipster neighborhood.

If you have time, it would be nice to have a chat or go out for a drink.
neighborhood_overview:
The location is walkable distance to famous Shimokitazawa, known to be a posh residential area without any high rise buildings. In just 10 minutes you can be at the heart of the trendy, funky, and bohemian Shimokitazawa that has a smorgasbord of affordable yet mouth-wateringly good restaurants and vintage clothes shops. The house is well situated in between train stations: 5 minutes walk to Ikenoue station on Inokashira line, 3rd stop from Shibuya station. 8 minutes walk to Shimokitazawa station on Odakyu line, 10 minutes from Shimokitazawa to Shinjuku by train. All very convenient!

I am happy to share the map for the near-by restaurant (breakfast, lunch and dinner) once the booking is done!

name: Homestay at Host's House -  Senju-Ohashi Station
description:
Our accommodation offers:

1. **Great Accessibility**
Just a short walk from Kitasenju Station, with easy access to Ueno, Asakusa, and Narita and Haneda airports. Ideal for sightseeing and business.

2. **Peaceful Environment**
Located in a quiet residential area, perfect for relaxing while enjoying city conveniences.

3. **Reliable Support**
Always available to help with any questions or concerns for a worry-free stay.

We aim to make your visit comfortable and memorable.

neighborhood_overview:
There are shopping mall near Senjuohashi station.
supermarket,restaurants(Mcdonald's,Yoshinoya,Otoya,Chinese,Italian ) are 5min away.

Big hub station,Kitasenju is walking distance.15min by foot.
From Kitasenju,you can go Ginza,Roppongi,Tsukiji,Tokyo sky tree,even Nikko,Hakone directly.


Close to fish market.
you can enjoy fresh sashimi.

There are many Japanese pubric bath called ' SENTO' near my house.Everybody take a bath all naked.
There are some rules to take a bath,so I will teach you how to enjoy SENTO.

name: Sophiearth Apartment in Shinjuku (A3-D1)
description: It is an one-room apartment with own toilet, shower, TV, refrigerator, microwave oven, .... It has one double sized bed and two single sized beds. The double bed measures 120-140 Cm wide and 200 Cm long. The maximum capacity of this apartment is four. The room has an air conditioner and heater.  New bedding is set for new guests. Weekly new bedding are prepared for a long-term guest.
view: Sophiearth Apartment in Shinjuku (A3-D1)It is an one-room apartment with own toilet, shower, TV, refrigerator, microwave oven, .... It has one double sized bed and two single sized beds. The double bed measures 120-140 Cm wide and 200 Cm long. The maximum capacity of this apartment is four. The room has an air conditioner and heater.  New bedding is set for new guests. Weekly new bedding are prepared for a long-term guest.
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Shinjuku, the heart of Tokyo, enabling you an easy access to most Tokyo attractions with minimal time, 30 minutes to Asakusa, Imperial Place, Harajuku, ... 1 hour by train to DisneyLand. There are many good restaurants nearby with quality meals at a competitive price. Though being located in a residential area, few minutes walk will lead you to many mouth-watering restaurants,  many convenient shops, and some attractions.  We are also close to Shinjuku Station, with many attractive tourism areas.

name: Wonderful Japanese style OTOME! (*Â´Ï‰ï½€)
description:
In this area, there is a cityscape with the atmosphere of Tokyo downtown.
Also, the Yanesen area is an area where the shrines and Buddhist temples are very many, yet the very charming area of the city center.There are many very delicious small restaurants, and many specialty stores such as grocery stores and butchers are also attractive.Please enjoy living in the Yanesen area, which has been cherished by local residents.
There are many customers from overseas, and some people can use it repeatedly every year.
The price is the same for up to 3 people.There is an extra charge from 4 people.
Architect's design that won the Grand Prix of the Landscape Award.
It is a rare building of wonderful Japanese style.
Accommodation for 7 guests in central Tokyo
It is near from famous sightseeing spots, YANAKA, SENDGI, NEZU (YANESEN).
It is very clean!!!

The nearest station is Musashi-Koyama station, 6 mins walking from our house. There is famous walking shopping street with a lot of restaurants, shops, cafes.
3 mins walking from the house, there is big pubic park.
We provide free car space for one car.

name: #2 Workdesk/Discover local life, culture & People
description: Hi, this is Toshi, an English speaker. Welcome to this neighborhood and my home. This area, called YaNeSen(Yanaka, Sendagi, Nezu), has preserved the charm as creating a contrast of old and new at the same time. It's because of the tendency to re-purpose older buildings rather than rebuilding. My home is a big house in good condition even located in central Tokyo. I manage this house as enjoying sharing life. In a word, the best place to feel local life in Tokyo.
view: #2 Workdesk/Discover local life, culture & PeopleHi, this is Toshi, an English speaker. Welcome to this neighborhood and my home. This area, called YaNeSen(Yanaka, Sendagi, Nezu), has preserved the charm as creating a contrast of old and new at the same time. It's because of the tendency to re-purpose older buildings rather than rebuilding. My home is a big house in good condition even located in central Tokyo. I manage this house as enjoying sharing life. In a word, the best place to feel local life in Tokyo.
neighborhood_overview:
Super convenient location to get around Tokyo.
6 min walk from the nearest subway station.
A gate area to central Tokyo from airport.

Here is a remaining authentic downtown in Tokyo. A quiet neighborhood with one of the most vivid local market street in Tokyo, beautiful sakura-lined cemetery, plenty of temples, old and new indie cafes, restaurants, shops and stalls, some of which have passed down through generations, and art galleries, etc. All of them are within 1-15 mins walking distance. So now here attracts both Japanese and foreigner visitors so much. Just lovely area.

- Local shopping street, Yanaka Ginza (10 mins walk)
- Yanaka Cemetery (10 mins walk)
- Ueno Park (15 mins walk)
- University of Tokyo (15 mins walk)
- 24/7 convenience store (5 min walk)
- Supermarket (6 min walk)
- Drugstores (3 min walk)

neighborhood_overview:
Â· An ideal neighborhood coveted even by locals! A quiet residential area nestled in the heart of Tokyo with quick and easy access to the JR Yamanote Line and major metropolitan centers and attractions. Perfect for travelers who want to immerse themselves in the chaos of the city by day and come home to a quiet home at night for rest.
Â· Plenty of cute side streets, parks, shops etc. to explore in the immediate area, if you don't feel like venturing too far. Guests often tell me about a restaurant or pub they've discovered close to the house that I didn't even know was there!
Â· Shinjuku, the biggest city in the Tokyo area, is 3 stops away on the Yamanote Line; Ikebukuro, another large, bustling city, is a short walk (10-15 mins) from the house.
Â· From Mejiro Station to my house is about a 7-minute walk. When you book your room, I will provide detailed instructions for getting to the house, both from Mejiro Station and from Haneda and Narita Airports. The instructions are c

description:

We completed the "enhanced cleaning protocol"

1. Prepare your equipment and get the
space ready for cleaning.

dust and debris.

3. Sanitize all high-touch areas,
appliances, and electronics.

4. Check that the space has been
thoroughly cleaned and sanitized

5. Reset the room for the next guest
and restock your supplies.

IN ADDITION TO THAT OUR HOME IS CLEANED & DISINFECTED TWICE A DAY

We are also distanced from the crowded streets of Tokyo and have a nice non-crowded park next door to our Home where you can balance heart and mind.

Please kindly note we are following the instructions from the Japanese government. Our priority is every one's health and so we have implemented safety hygiene measures at Home, which are required to be followed by our guests at all times while at home or any outdoor activitie

name: Diplomat House/Mansion near by JR Station in Tokyo
description: Welcome to our cozy shared house!  Enjoy the spacious living areas, fully equipped kitchen, and two toilets/showers. Conveniently located with easy access to transportation and local amenities. Experience comfort and community in our welcoming home!
view: Diplomat House/Mansion near by JR Station in TokyoWelcome to our cozy shared house!  Enjoy the spacious living areas, fully equipped kitchen, and two toilets/showers. Conveniently located with easy access to transportation and local amenities. Experience comfort and community in our welcoming home!
neighborhood_overview:
House is built only in 1990 after demolishing 2 houses next to each other by my parents. My father was in the diplomatic arena. My mother was in real estate.

Explain briefly about the area where the house is located: Major development occurred in the end of 1800 in this area when many novel writers and started to move to this area Along with the mid-1870s the Omori Station has been built. It was the one of the first railway stations made in Japanese history. Later on Pre-world war 2 time, this area used to be a foreign compound for Europeans and westerners. However, when the war started, everybody left except for the German nationals, as Germany was the ally of Japan and German school used to operate in the neighbor until the end of 1980s. They moved to Yokohama due to shortage of capacity. So there used to be many European families used to live here for pupils to attend school in this area. description:
For having fun with your special friends and for the vacation with your family (up to 16).
Condominium with big rooftop located in Sakurashinmachi, Setagaya.

Once you go up the spiral staircase, you will have a nice view of Tokyo.

Distinguished and spacious condo to enjoy living in Tokyo with modest luxury.

Stylish Apartment in Tokyo with Rooftop & Blue SkyFor having fun with your special friends and for the vacation with your family (up to 16).
Condominium with big rooftop located in Sakurashinmachi, Setagaya.

Once you go up the spiral staircase, you will have a nice view of Tokyo.

neighborhood_overview: Escape the noise of downtown Tokyo, while maintaining easy access to the major sights, in this comfortable studio apartment located in the upscale residential area, Setagaya. Experience a slice of Tokyo life, while enjoying one of the many parks in the area, including the Olympic park. Take the nearby Den-en-toshi line to reach two contrasting shopping areas a few stops away: Futako-Tamagawa on one side provides all the conveniences of a major shopping center, and Sangenjaya a place to get lost in the narrow streets lined with restaurants and shops. A stop away from Sangenjaya and you reach Shibuya, allowing you to access all that Tokyo has to offer.

neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in the vicinity of the Hanegi-no-Mori of Shinyoda Station, so it is surrounded by buildings of high architectural value and a lot of nature.

There are bakeries, florists, and curry shops in the neighborhood, and convenience stores are also close by.

There are many Japanese shops such as ramen shop, yakitori, Kushikatsu, and Motsu Nabe-san, and 10 minutes walk to the youth city of Shimokitazawa.

Shibuya and Shinjuku are also easily accessible, and both arrive in about 20 minutes.

neighborhood_overview:
Bunkyo-ku is located in the center of Tokyo.Access for sightseeing in Tokyo is a great place.Downtown Nezu in Tokyo retains the appearance of the Edo period, the Meiji period, the Taisho period, and the Showa period.There are many wooden houses and narrow alleys, dotted with Nezu shrines and temples built in 1706.Please feel the mood of downtown Japan.
Since the University of Tokyo and the University of the Arts are also nearby, many cultural people spent their youth and lived here.Restaurants, supermarkets, hospitals, transportation, everything.
The large Ueno Park is also about a 12-minute walk away.The National Museum, Western Art Museum, Shinobi Ike, Zoo, Temple, Shrine, various events are held.Ueno Park is also a cherry blossom spot, and many people visit.
Yanaka Ginza is also a shopping street that retains the atmosphere of downtown Japan, about a 12-minute walk away.Please take a walk.

name: #1 Discover local life, culture & People/Work desk
description: Hi, this is Toshi, an English speaker. Welcome to this neighborhood and my home. This area, called YaNeSen(Yanaka, Sendagi, Nezu), has preserved the charm as creating a contrast of old and new at the same time. It's because of the tendency to re-purpose older buildings rather than rebuilding. My home is a big house in good condition even located in central Tokyo. I manage this house as enjoying sharing life. In a word, the best place to feel local life in Tokyo.
view: #1 Discover local life, culture & People/Work deskHi, this is Toshi, an English speaker. Welcome to this neighborhood and my home. This area, called YaNeSen(Yanaka, Sendagi, Nezu), has preserved the charm as creating a contrast of old and new at the same time. It's because of the tendency to re-purpose older buildings rather than rebuilding. My home is a big house in good condition even located in central Tokyo. I manage this house as enjoying sharing life. In a word, the best place to feel local life in Tokyo.
neighborhood_overview:
Super convenient location to get around Tokyo.
6 min walk from the nearest subway station.
A gate area to central Tokyo from airport.

Here is a remaining authentic downtown in Tokyo. A quiet neighborhood with one of the most vivid local market street in Tokyo, beautiful sakura-lined cemetery, plenty of temples, old and new indie cafes, restaurants, shops and stalls, some of which have passed down through generations, and art galleries, etc. All of them are within 1-15 mins walking distance. So now here attracts both Japanese and foreigner visitors so much. Just lovely area.

- Local shopping street, Yanaka Ginza (10 mins walk)
- Yanaka Cemetery (10 mins walk)
- Ueno Park (15 mins walk)
- University of Tokyo (15 mins walk)
- 24/7 convenience store (5 min walk)
- Supermarket (6 min walk)
- Drugstores (3 min walk)

description: Discover the perfect blend of convenience and comfort in this charming apartment, ideally situated just a 2-minute walk from Takenotsuka Station. neighborhood_overview: ACCORDING TO WIKIPEDIA :- "HIROO IS ONE OF THE MOST PROMINENT UPMARKET RESIDENTIAL AND SHOPPING NEIGHBORHOOD IN TOKYO". Here you have it.  Literally about 200 steps to Hiroo station and less to the "ShotenGai" (Hiroo Village). HIROO is the most sought after address in Tokyo by foreign expats and wealthy Japanese. Hiroo has the best of both West and East with a popular large picturesque park/garden area of Arisugawa Gardens near by. Hiroo offers great central Tokyo location, and the house is only 2 minute walk from the station, in a back street in a very quiet neighborhood. Shops, restaurants, bars, taxis, a large park, a huge supermarket very few minutes away.

neighborhood_overview:
"Hostel Hana An" is located in typical Japanese shopping street.
There are â€œSentoâ€(Japanese style public bath), restaurant and popular noodle restaurant in the shopping street.
Recently there are more fashionable cafes near â€œHostel Hana Anâ€.

â€œShibamataâ€ is the town known in famous movie series named â€œOtoko ha tsuraiyoâ€.
â€œDaikyo-ji templeâ€ known as â€œShibamata Taishakutenâ€ is very crowded in fair.
There is â€œYagiri no watashiâ€ on the â€œEdogawa riverâ€ in behind the temple.
â€œShibamataâ€ is the next station of â€œKeisei Kanamachiâ€.

It is a 15-minute bicycle ride to the largest scale park in Tokyo named â€œMizumoto Parkâ€.
Near the Mizumoto Park, there is "Shibarare-Jizo"(Jizo bound with rope). Shibarare-Jizo has collected faith since the Edo period.
(There are 2 free rental bicycles.)

name: Sunny House in a Leafy Street
description: Sunny House in the leafy suburb of Eifukucho is solitary house. Really peaceful residential suburb but easy to access Tokyo. Just 5 minutes to Shimokitizawa and 10 to Shiubya. Easy access to Studio Ghibli and great for a day trip to the mountains.
view: Sunny House in a Leafy StreetSunny House in the leafy suburb of Eifukucho is solitary house. Really peaceful residential suburb but easy to access Tokyo. Just 5 minutes to Shimokitizawa and 10 to Shiubya. Easy access to Studio Ghibli and great for a day trip to the mountains.
neighborhood_overview:
Eifukucho is a quieter more family orientated suburb of Tokyo. It is a very leafy neighbourhood for Tokyo! It is situated on one of the main rivers that run through the city, the cherry blossom lined Kanda River. Located in the west of Tokyo making it easy to go for a trip to the mountains for the day. Eifukucho is a very safe area with lots of convenience stores, a supermarket right near the station and great local places to eat.

We can recommend lots of great local things to do in the area, and we also has a map which they can send to you of the area as well as great Tokyo.

If you are interested a friend of my father's is an expert in Japanese tea ceremonies and she lives just around the corner from our house in her traditional Japanese house. We would love to take you there!

There are famous Sushi, Tempura, Sukiyaki, and Soba restaurants and Izakaya within a 5 minute walk. For those looking for a quick bite early or late, there are 3 convenience stores within 5 minutes and a Denny's' around the corner. Less than 1 minute to the TOBU grocery store!

For families with small children, there are extensive playgrounds and parks so everyone can have a good time.

Convenient, safe and quiet; come experience a traditional area of Tokyo.

neighborhood_overview:
The Neighborhood
â–  Overview of neighborhood
The apartment is six minutes away from Funabori Station, the area is quiet, and the residents are all nice people. There are lots of small restaurants in the area, and travelers are very welcome.

There is also a supermarket, three minutes walk away from the apartment. It is convenient for buying daily necessities, food, and medical supplies.

On the premises of the apartment, there is a hot spring with a 400 year history. It also has a sauna. In Japan this is called a "Public Bath"â†â€Sen-to" and people pay to enter the baths.
Eat some delicious food, relax in the hot spring, and make yourself feel at home in the room.

Located about 10 to 15 min. away from the center of Machida.
It's at the foot of short slope.(1 min.)The guest's room is small but cozy on the second floor with a comfortable double sized bed(195cmx140cm) Across from the room there is a private TV and sofa. It is a nice peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the great city even though it is close to the center of Machida.
FYI: This is not recommended for the guests who don't like slopes or have knee problems.
view:
Middle of Shinjuku and KamakuraLocated about 10 to 15 min. away from the center of Machida.
It's at the foot of short slope.(1 min.)The guest's room is small but cozy on the second floor with a comfortable double sized bed(195cmx140cm) Across from the room there is a private TV and sofa. It is a nice peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the great city even though it is close to the center of Machida.
FYI: This is not recommended for the guests who don't like slopes or have knee problems.
neighborhood_overview:
My neighborhood is very quiet, but also very close to all the tourist spots.
You can enjoy a lot of Japanese food in the center of Machida.
Sushi,Tempura,Sukiyaki,Oden,Kaiseki,you name it. Other than Japanese food there are some Italian,Chinese,European,Indian, other Asian food as well.
Also you can enjoy at Izakayas,amusement centers(pachinco parlors.game centers),which are within only 10-15 minute walk from the house.
The nearest convenience store is 5min. away .

There's a beautiful park with a museum in it nearby my house.
In the spring,you can enjoy beautiful cherry blossoms and in the fall,beautiful colored leaves.

name: Clean and comfortable apartment in Machida, Tokyo
description:
The house is 1DK, 25 square meters in size and can comfortably accommodate up to two people. Surrounded by a residential area, a short walk brings you to lush green nature, which is perhaps rare in Tokyo. Why don't you spend a relaxing time in a room where you can feel such comfort?

This space is located in a room on the first floor of a two-story apartment owned by my father. Located in a residential area and facing south, you can spend your time comfortably.
view:
Clean and comfortable apartment in Machida, TokyoThe house is 1DK, 25 square meters in size and can comfortably accommodate up to two people. Surrounded by a residential area, a short walk brings you to lush green nature, which is perhaps rare in Tokyo. Why don't you spend a relaxing time in a room where you can feel such comfort?

This space is located in a room on the first floor of a two-story apartment owned by my father. Located in a residential area and facing south, you can spend your time comfortably.
neighborhood_overview:
Near the apartment is the Shinkoji River, where you can take a pleasant walk or jog on the promenade.
Supermarkets and convenience stores are within a 5-minute walk, so you will have no trouble in your daily life.
A lovely old private house called Buaiso is located nearby. If you are interested in vintage-looking old houses and pottery or literature, this is a must-see.

neighborhood_overview:
The Neighborhood
â–  Overview of neighborhood
The apartment is six minutes away from Funabori Station, the area is quiet, and the residents are all nice people. There are lots of small restaurants in the area, and travelers are very welcome.

There is also a supermarket, three minutes walk away from the apartment. It is convenient for buying daily necessities, food, and medical supplies.

On the premises of the apartment, there is a hot spring with a 400 year history. It also has a sauna. In Japan this is called a "Public Bath"â†â€Sen-to" and people pay to enter the baths.
Eat some delicious food, relax in the hot spring, and make yourself feel at home in the room.

name: 2 TINY Apartments - 1 Listing Central Tokyo Nakano
description: 2 TINY apartments that together make a spacious location in the heart of Tokyo! 1 apartment on top of the other, perfect for up to 6 guests. I do advertise the properties separately, so if you are booking this listing, it's because you have a family of more than 3 staying.  5 minutes from JR Higashinakano station, which offers tons of restaurants, 50 meters away from 5 other superb restaurants ranging from Japanese to Spanish. Come and enjoy this charming and vibrant neighborhood like a local!
view: 2 TINY Apartments - 1 Listing Central Tokyo Nakano2 TINY apartments that together make a spacious location in the heart of Tokyo! 1 apartment on top of the other, perfect for up to 6 guests. I do advertise the properties separately, so if you are booking this listing, it's because you have a family of more than 3 staying.  5 minutes from JR Higashinakano station, which offers tons of restaurants, 50 meters away from 5 other superb restaurants ranging from Japanese to Spanish. Come and enjoy this charming and vibrant neighborhood like a local!
neighborhood_overview: Central Tokyo is gathering of many small â€œcitiesâ€ called wards, one of them is Nakano. In a recent census, Nakano has a population of 300 thousand people offering with a population density of 20,000 people per squared kilometer. In simple words very nicely packed and crowded. This offers many things to do! Choosing Nakano as your center has many advantages, including being right next to Shinjuku, but getting much more living space at a much lower cost. In addition, this vibrant part of the city is not as crowded as Shinjuku, but still full of action. And if you insist on going to Shinjuku where 3.5 million people transit per day you will be able to do it in just 10 minutes.

description: Domus Musashino is located in a quiet residential area, 2 minutes from train station , along a direct line straight to Seibu Shinjuku. You will get keys of this full equipped ground level apartment in front cycleâ€™s lane with cherry blossom trees.
view: DOMUS MUSASHINO -Sakura View-Domus Musashino is located in a quiet residential area, 2 minutes from train station , along a direct line straight to Seibu Shinjuku. You will get keys of this full equipped ground level apartment in front cycleâ€™s lane with cherry blossom trees.
neighborhood_overview:
It's located in a residential and green area near Koganei Park, 3min. on walk from Hanakoganei Station, along a bike lane and less than 1min from convenience store open H/24.
The area even residential have got a lot of restaurant, supermarket, shop, dojo, swiming pool, child playground, bamboo park and Kodaira Furusato village museum. If you would like to have an experience of Japanese traditional SPA (Hot springs-ONSEN), the nearest one is just 15 min by walk on bike lane. Laundromat is around 10min walk on bike lane too.

Along the bike lane (jitensha dori) of Musashino city area you can easily reach EDO AIR open museum, Kichijoji, Mitaka and Studio Ghibli by bike or bus.

view: Shinjuku/Shin-Okubo 5 min Comfy 2BR [HL4A]Spacious 2BR  equipped with semi-double size beds (120cm x 200cm) in each room. The kitchen and dining space are separated from the bedrooms. Separated bathroom and toilet. Great for family members and friends to share and explore Tokyo from Shinjuku!
neighborhood_overview:
Located close to central Shinjuku area. 15-20 min walk to Shinjuku. Edge of Shin Okubo where it's known as Korean/Asian town in Tokyo. Lively streets with convenience stores, restaurants, grocery shops, supermarkets, etc. You can fully enjoy Tokyo from the hub!!

* Matsumotokiyoshi pharmacy / Big chain pharmacy. 1 min from the house.
* CVS / Lawson, Family Mart and 7-11. The closest one is Lawson. 1 min from the house.
* Supermarket Santoku. 2 min from the house
* Can Do 100 yen shop / Almost everything is sold for 100JPY plus tax., there is a money exchange machine, 5 min from the house.

There are many restaurants and shopping. You donâ€™t have to worry about eating. And our house is very safe.

Pure love shopping street, old bookstores, personal groceries, special shops, awo dances, full of Japanese authentic atmosphere of the 1970s and 1980s.
Shichijo Shopping Street, let you enjoy the leisure life of Koenji Temple.
Walk around the old bookstore and maybe accidentally find the one you've been looking for (work).
Personalized groceries, unique shops, let you enjoy the art of Takayama Temple, bring your own native.
The famous traditional Apo dance, on the weekend at the end of August, two consecutive days, experience the Japanese Summer Festival.
4 mins walk from the station, 24-hour convenience supermarkets, fresh supermarkets, cheap drugstores, coffee shops, bars, izakayas, Japanese cuisine, McDonald's, etc.Travel life is satisfying.

neighborhood_overview:
The house is in a quiet and safe street. The streets are fairly typical of suburban Tokyo and some urban hiking reveals interesting architecture as well as many green spaces.

On days when you want to stick close to home, the neighbourhood bustles with restaurants, cafes, bars, shops and other amenities. There is a grocery store nearby perfect for stocking breakfast and for snacks, we suggest any of the nearby convenience stores which are open 24 hours.

We've drawn up a neighborhood map to help you find what you need.

We have also included a selection of novels and travel brochures, walking maps and a Lonely Planet for you to use during your stay. We are happy to recommend out of the way places and local knowledge of our combined 20 years living in Tokyo.

neighborhood_overview:
Hatagaya is a very convenient area for getting around Tokyo and it also has a great local feel, but only 3 minutes to Shinjuku station. Nishihara street, the local street in Hatagaya is great for taking a stroll along, it will give you the feeling of being a local in Tokyo. It has lots of great small shops and local Japanese restaurants as well as a local sento (bathhouse).

The local supermarket is close to the station, and convenience stores open 24hrs. Hatagaya has everything you need in Tokyo.

name: TINY Home in Shibuya Close to Shinjuku
description: Located in the hip neighborhood of Hatagaya in the Shibuya district, this house puts you  in the heart of Tokyo with superb access to Shinjuku (4 min)  and Shibuya (10 min). Filled with restaurants, bars and cafes Hatagaya will surely be a place you call home!
view: TINY Home in Shibuya Close to ShinjukuLocated in the hip neighborhood of Hatagaya in the Shibuya district, this house puts you  in the heart of Tokyo with superb access to Shinjuku (4 min)  and Shibuya (10 min). Filled with restaurants, bars and cafes Hatagaya will surely be a place you call home!
neighborhood_overview: This Nishihara TINY house is located 4 minutes from the Hatagaya station in the HEART of Tokyo. A 4-minute train ride takes you to the vibrant Shinjuku station hub. (i.e.: 15 - 20 minutes walking which is absolutely prime).  Shinjuku is one of Tokyo major hub station transiting approximately 3.5 million people a day and itâ€™s VERY EXITING. Being 4 minutes away from Shinjuku gives you the best of all worlds as a 4-minute train ride takes you to the exiting world of Shinjuku and at night when you have had enough of the crowds you will be able to come to your quite spot in the city for some shuteye. Please note that while I say "quiet" it is just relative as Hatagaya is still VERY LIVELY under any international standards with dozens of restaurants and bars open 24X7.

name: Nishi-Ogikubo 1BR Twin Type-B 2F
description: Our latest 1 bedroom with two beds is fully furnished with brand-new furniture, clean and well equipped with modern amenities. This 35-square-meter apartment features a full kitchen and a bathroom with bathtub. (max. accommodation 4 persons)
view: Nishi-Ogikubo 1BR Twin Type-B 2FOur latest 1 bedroom with two beds is fully furnished with brand-new furniture, clean and well equipped with modern amenities. This 35-square-meter apartment features a full kitchen and a bathroom with bathtub. (max. accommodation 4 persons)
neighborhood_overview: Nishi-Ogikubo is a quiet, safe, and peaceful neighborhood where you almost forget you are only a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the big city of Tokyo. The town is well-known for its numerous antique shops, unique cafes, and secondhand book stores, providing entertainment for all generations. There are also some parks around the neighborhood such as Zenpukuji Park and Inokashira Park. They are both famous for cherry blossom viewing and their autumn leaves. Also, just a 10-minute walk from the station there is a shrine that is believed to be a spiritual place where you can gain benefits from a mystical force.

name: Direct NaritAirport/Shinjuku/Akihabara/Tokyo Sta.
description:
Dear friends,would you like to experience Japanese customs?Then,this B&B would be your best choice.
Our B&B is located on a shopping street,a 10-minute walk from the north exit of ShinKoiwa Station on the JR Sobu Line that connects to Narita Airport and runs throughTokyo.
The area near ShinKoiwa Sta. is very prosperous.There are various restaurants,24-hour large supermarkets and Don Quixote stores,which would be a good place to buy gifts.Also,some nearby drugstores are often open until midnight.
view:
Direct NaritAirport/Shinjuku/Akihabara/Tokyo Sta.Dear friends,would you like to experience Japanese customs?Then,this B&B would be your best choice.
Our B&B is located on a shopping street,a 10-minute walk from the north exit of ShinKoiwa Station on the JR Sobu Line that connects to Narita Airport and runs throughTokyo.
The area near ShinKoiwa Sta. is very prosperous.There are various restaurants,24-hour large supermarkets and Don Quixote stores,which would be a good place to buy gifts.Also,some nearby drugstores are often open until midnight.
neighborhood_overview: Our B&B is located on the shopping street at the north exit of Shin-Koiwa Station. Within a 2-minute walk from our house, there are 24-hour convenience stores, supermarkets, butchers, fruit shops, pharmacies, laundry rooms, restaurants, and Japanese food shops. We strongly recommend that you take a night in our B&B and taste various and fresh Japanese food nearby, such as sashimi, grilled fish, tempura, oden, Japanese yakitori, Japanese fried chicken, Japanese pickles, takoyaki, dorayaki, etc. After enjoying food, it's also worth walking 9 minutes to enjoy a natural hot spring and complete the experience of Japanese life!

neighborhood_overview: Azabujuban is a high-end residential area in Minato-ku,Tokyo.It is very central Tokyo with a perfect mix of quaint shops, upscale restaurants and trendy cafÃ©s.  The close proximity to Roppongi (itâ€™s literally right behind Roppongi Hills) and the many Embassies around the area make it one of the most popular and desirable residential areas in Tokyo.  Many celebrities and politicians live in our neighborhood so there is a always a constant police presence in the area.  The main street of Azabujuban is a stretch of adorable cobblestone paving that winds through the middle of the neighborhood with a fun and friendly small town feeling even though it is the middle of bustling Tokyo.Among the boutiques and trendy cafes, youâ€™ll also find 100 yen shops, reasonably priced supermarkets and small independent operators who differentiate themselves by offering extra value compared to the big chains.24H open super market is the same block.And many nice restaurantes and 24H open Tsutaya Roppongi is i

name: Experience Japan in a Japanese House in Shinjuku!
description: Discover the charm of a traditional Japanese lifestyle in this cozy, newly renovated two-story home. The house features a comfortable living room, a serene tatami bedroom, a stylish dining room, and a fully equipped kitchenâ€”all tastefully furnished for your stay. Nestled in a peaceful residential neighborhood, you're just minutes away from the vibrant hubs of Shinjuku and Shibuya. Perfect for those looking to enjoy a quiet retreat with easy access to Tokyo's top attractions!
view: Experience Japan in a Japanese House in Shinjuku!Discover the charm of a traditional Japanese lifestyle in this cozy, newly renovated two-story home. The house features a comfortable living room, a serene tatami bedroom, a stylish dining room, and a fully equipped kitchenâ€”all tastefully furnished for your stay. Nestled in a peaceful residential neighborhood, you're just minutes away from the vibrant hubs of Shinjuku and Shibuya. Perfect for those looking to enjoy a quiet retreat with easy access to Tokyo's top attractions!
neighborhood_overview:
The house is right in the heart of Tokyo in a traditional Japanese residential area. Most tourist attractions can be reached within 20 minutes.
â€¢Shinjuku (14 minutes)
â€¢Shibuya (19 minutes)
â€¢Akihabara (18 minutes)
â€¢Roppongi (20 minutes)
â€¢ Studio Ghibli (23 minutes direct train connection)
â€¢Narita Airport (70 minutes)
â€¢Haneda Airport (50 minutes)
The house is just a short walk from Waseda Station (Tozai Line) and Ushigome-Yanagicho Station (Oedo-Line). Kagurazaka, one of Tokyo`s most popular tourist destinations is just a 10 minutes away. You can also walk to Waseda where one of Japan`s most prestigious universities is located. Waseda is famous reasonably priced restaurants and its relaxed atmosphere.

description: Family-type non-smoking house  near Ajinomoto Studium, Tokyo University of Foreign Studies, ICU , Sakakibara Hospital and American School in Japan,  40 minutes from Shinjuku, good transportations, 8-10 miniute-walk from Tama station , 12 miniute-walk from Musashino-dai station on Keio line, bus service to Mitaka /Chofu/Fuchu/Musashi Koganei stations, upper-middle residential/colledge town near SAEKI supermarckets . There are a convenience store and a drug store in 3-5 minute-walking distance.
view: Cozy House near Ajinomoto Studium TUFS/ICU/ASIJFamily-type non-smoking house  near Ajinomoto Studium, Tokyo University of Foreign Studies, ICU , Sakakibara Hospital and American School in Japan,  40 minutes from Shinjuku, good transportations, 8-10 miniute-walk from Tama station , 12 miniute-walk from Musashino-dai station on Keio line, bus service to Mitaka /Chofu/Fuchu/Musashi Koganei stations, upper-middle residential/colledge town near SAEKI supermarckets . neighborhood_overview:
Convenience store in three minute walk, Big drug store "Coco kara Fine" in 5 minute-walk distance, Post Office in 10-minute-walk distance.
5 minute to Big shopping area in Musashisakai by train (from Tama station on Seibu Tamagawa Line) .
For lunch and supper, the cafeterias and dinning room at Tokyo University of Foreign Studies(TUFS, 10-minute -walk from our house, in front of Tama station) are open to the public in a beautiful green campus.
TUFS also opens its library (it is requested to fill in a request form ) and cafe to the puclic.
There is a popular 'lunch box' shop 'Sankichi' in front of Tama station.

neighborhood_overview: The area around Hounancho is mainly residential and relatively suburban.  There are a number of small rivers in the area, which makes it nice for jogging or just taking a walk.  There are two 24 hour diner type "family restaurants", and a supermarket and convenience stores.  There are some smaller cafes and an indian restaurant as well..  You can get pizza delivery too if you like!

Though Higashimurayama has not known so much by foreigners,there are so many cultural heritage and the local feeling and communication that you can not experience in the busy areas.
1)The only National Treasure in Tokyo is here in Higashimurayama city. ShofukuTemple is the only one selected in Tokyo as most fascinating 100 architectures of the world.
2)Hachikoku mountain is known as a place forms in the setting of the Ghibli movie,Totoro.
3)There are many different restaurant types out here varied from Sushi,Tempura,Ramen,and some other non-Japanese cuisine such as Indian,Italian,Chinese,Korean,and so on.

description: Bright modern apartment with chic, minimalistic decor. Conveniently located 6 minutes walk away from Hatagaya station, this studio is 2 stops away from the busiest station in the world, Shinjuku, making it the perfect to live in Tokyo. neighborhood_overview:
Hatagaya is a very convenient area for getting around Tokyo and it also has a great local feel, but only 3 minutes to Shinjuku station. Nishihara street, the local street in Hatagaya is great for taking a stroll along, it will give you the feeling of being a local in Tokyo. It has lots of great small shops and local Japanese restaurants.

The local supermarket is close to the station, and convenience stores open 24hrs. Hatagaya has everything you need in Tokyo !

view: 402 Â· Tokyo sta/Nihonbasi/Imperial Palace/Ginza, #402We are located in the center of Tokyo city  , within walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Akihabara (within 15-20min);near to the Bank of Japan,etc.. including the JR line, the Ginza line, the Hanzomon line, the Hibiya line, the Asakusa line, and so on.It is also very convenient for visitors, who come and go  to  Narita and Haneda airports. neighborhood_overview:
Our place is located in the center area of Tokyo city , within walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Ginza and Akihabara (within 15-20min);near to the Bank of Japan, the Mitsukoshi Isetan department store, the Muromachi shopping center, etc., where you can buy Japanese souvenirs and enjoy Japanese food.
There are many subway routes in the area, including the JR line, the Ginza line, the Hanzomon line, the Hibiya line, the Asakusa line, and so on.
It is a 4-minutes walk from Mitsukoshimae Station ( Metro Ginza Line and Metro Hanzomon Line) , and a 4-minute walk from Kodenmacho Station ( Metro Hibiya Line).
It is also very convenient for visitors, who come and go to Narita and Haneda airports. There is a shuttle bus from the airport to Tokyo Station and this way ,currently, is the most comfortable, cheapest and fastest route. We are located just 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station .

Hiroo is one of most popular residential neighborhood in Tokyo.
There are many restaurants and shops in Hiroo and it is very easy to access to Ebisu, Roppongi (3min by subway), Shibuya and Omote-sando (within 3km).

description:
Welcome to a vintage town called "Shitamachi area" in Tokyo!
You can feel like time slip to 1960's Tokyo (old but comfortable atmosphere).
Here is not a center of Tokyo though, there are a lot of nice local restaurants or food shops.
And easy access to center of Tokyo like ASAKUSA, SKYTREE, GINZA,UENO,AKIHABARA,TOKYO etc and Haneda/Narita airport.

I just renovated my house as modern Japanese style which is mixed with Western essence a bit.
7mins walk from Keisei Tateishi station.
* Not JR line

view: #3/22.5ãŽ¡/Japanese Modern Apt, 2 Stops to ShinjukuNewly renovated apartment with custom made furniture. 6 min walk to Hatagaya station, which is 2 stops / 3 min to Shinjuku station by train. neighborhood_overview:
Hatagaya is a very convenient area for getting around Tokyo and it also has a great local feel, but only 3 minutes to Shinjuku station. Nishihara street, the local street in Hatagaya is great for taking a stroll along, it will give you the feeling of being a local in Tokyo. It has lots of great small shops and local Japanese restaurants as well as a local sento (bathhouse).

The local supermarket is close to the station, and convenience stores open 24hrs. Hatagaya has everything you need in Tokyo.

name: Room available in Brand New House
description: As the title says, I have an extra bedroom in my brand new house in Ikebukuro.  The room has a single bed and can fit either a single traveler, a couple, or two travelers by putting down an extra futon.
view: Room available in Brand New HouseAs the title says, I have an extra bedroom in my brand new house in Ikebukuro.  The room has a single bed and can fit either a single traveler, a couple, or two travelers by putting down an extra futon.
neighborhood_overview: It is kind of a quiet, upscale neighborhood with many other new houses around, yet it's only a short walk away from the hustle and bustle of Ikebukuro, one of the major hubs on the Yamanote line which circles the city. One of the great things about the location is that there is a Don Quixote shopping center only three minutes away. They have everything at this place, from alcohol to groceries, toiletries to amusement items, all at prices much lower than other retail shops.

neighborhood_overview:
Hatagaya is a very convenient area for getting around Tokyo and it also has a great local feel, but only 3 minutes to Shinjuku station. Nishihara street, the local street in Hatagaya is great for taking a stroll along, it will give you the feeling of being a local in Tokyo. It has lots of great small shops and local Japanese restaurants as well as a local sento (bathhouse).

The local supermarket is close to the station, and convenience stores open 24hrs. Hatagaya has everything you need in Tokyo.

neighborhood_overview:
There are many restaurants, Supermarket, 24hours open convenience store and so on.
Japan buckwheat, Yakitori and Yakiniku(grilled beef), Chinese restaurant, German sausage shop, and fresh fish store are located in the neighborhood.
There is public coin park nearby, its 1mins from the room to there. If you rent a car, don't worry!
The equestrian stadium in 2020 is with in walking distance.

Komazawa olympic park is nearby. This park is huge and comfortable. This place normally has many events going on here during weekends. Sporting events as well as food events. In sunny weekends there are many people having fun, taking a rest, reading books. You can do whatever you would like to.

The water tower was built in 1923 has become a landmark of Sakurashimmachi.
A few times a year, light-up is done. You can see it at the entrance.

Please ask the host if there are things you want to know.
We hope to help you during stay in Japan.

neighborhood_overview:
â˜…AREAâ˜…
Asakusabashi is an area below Asakusa and Ueno, full of interesting little shops. Its history dates back to the Edo era, where it prospered as a town for the working class. With stores selling dolls, beads, and other paraphernalia, and even rental stores where you can rent boats, this area might very well be one of the few places where you can experience Tokyo at its most comfortable.

â˜…PLACES TO EATâ˜…
Matsuya - 3 min walk
Sukiya - 2 min walk
Many cafes & eateries within a 3 min walk (most open from 7:30)

name: ã€1/Fã€‘Asakusabashi Building | for 6-8 ppl
description:
Our hostel is located in the heart of Tokyo, 5 minutes on foot from Asakusabashi Station, to Akihabara Station, with a large appliance mall "Yodobashi Camera" and the 24-hour "Don Quirande" department store, just a 15-minute walk away. There are many parking lots, supermarkets, convenience stores, restaurants, drugstores, 100yen shops near our apartment..... Then there is a large coin laundry shop 140 meters away from our apartment.It takes only 2 ~ 5 minutes to attractions such as Asakusa Red Gate, Sky Tree, Ueno by train, very convenient transportation.
Our apartment hotel is 5 floors high,
Each floor is a private floor passcode door door access.
Yes, there is no elevator.

neighborhood_overview:
You can access to this apartment by direct train of NARITA ACCESS EXPRESS from both Narita Airport and Haneda Airport. (There are 1-2 direct trains per hour, mainly in rush hour*, please check the timetable on the official site for reference http )

From Narita Airport or Haneda Airport, you can choose to take the "Narita access Express" train directly to the apartment.(No transfer during busy hours, you can reach Asakusabashi Station directly, about one or two direct trains an hour, details can be found on the official website schedule)

- ç¾½ç”°æ©Ÿå ´ Haneda Airport (40 mins)
- Narita Airport (65mins)

5 minutes walk from Asakusabashi Station.
Take JR Chuo-Sobu Line to Akihabara Station, you can interchange to other railway lines there.
Suggest using JR Yamamote line, it is the busiest railway in Tokyo and it can bring you to different scenic spots.

The apartment is situated in Asakusa. If you like shopping, you can go to Uno Ameya-Yoko

name: 3 min from Aoyama 1-chome Staä¸¨Max 3PPLä¸¨Bike Share
description:
Located in Minato-ku, central Tokyo. It is only a 3min walk from Aoyama Itchome Sta, and you can also walk to the very popular Meiji Jingu Gaien!

*caution
No elevator, and narrow stairs.

*You'll be required to show your passport upon check-in.
*This property is non-smoking, including the balcony.
*Please note that in the case of same-day reservations, we may not be able to meet the 3:00 pm check-in time due to the cleaning schedule.

neighborhood_overview:
ï¿­AREAï¿­
With fashionable tall commercial buildings standing on both sides of the road, there are some green places like Akasaka Imperial Palace around Aoyama Itchome station. Also, you can buy daily commodities at a supermarket just in front of the station. It seems that it has everything a high living quality environment needs. It takes only 11 minutes to Meiji Jingu Gaien by foot.

Aoyama Itchome Station has 3 railway lines, therefore access to sightseeing spots is excellent! If you use the Oedo Line, you can easily go to the Warner Bros. Studio Tour Tokyo â€“ The Making of Harry Potter, also known as Harry Potter Studio. Azabudai Hills, a popular tourist spot, is about 10 minutes away by taxi, allowing you to fully enjoy the new facilities of Tokyo.

A convenience store and supermarket are just 3 minutes away from listing! It is extremely convenient for foreign guests if you need to buy something even in the middle of the night. Staying at a residence street

description: Want to enjoy privacy in a private room at a reasonable price?  Then come to my room! Quiet but convenient place in central Tokyo.  We welcome you because I and my family live on the upper floor in the same house.  We can give tips for your trip plan.  24hours supermarket is only 1minute from the house.  You can cook in your room as if you live in it.  Good idea to try a public bath 3minutes on foot.  Hot spring?  At the next station.  No curfew.  Good for sightseeing, business trip, study, etc.

neighborhood_overview:
Next to Ikebukuro on JR Yamanote line is Otsuka. Otsuka is famous for its music, rose, and pubs. There are many small live houses, pubs, cafes and restaurants. People come to see the roses beside the tram line in May and October. There are 24 hours supermarkets, drugstores, convenience stores, and launderette nearby. You can walk to Ikebukuro. It takes about 15 minutes on foot to Sunshine shopping center and Animate. There are several universities around the area. Tokyo University is very close to the Metro. Otsuka is at the center of Tokyo, which has a casual atmosphere and also an academic atmosphere. Sugamo â€œHarajuku of Grandmaâ€ is also within walking distance. If you want to walk to Ikebukuro or Sugamo, we can tell you the way. Just ask us! You can try tram to Asukayama and Waseda especially during the season of cherry blossom.

description:

neighborhood_overview:
The area surrounding Oyama Station in Itabashi Ward, Tokyo, is a captivating blend of urban living and traditional charm. The highlight of Oyama Station is the Oyama ShÅtengai(named â€œHappy Roadâ€), which is renowned as the third longest shopping street in Tokyo. Within walking distance from our accommodation, you'll find a variety of shops, restaurants, and supermarkets. The Oyama Happy Road offers a wide range of daily necessities, including fresh food that you can purchase and cook in your accommodation. If you prefer not to cook, there are also many restaurants in the Oyama Happy Road offering traditional Japanese cuisine, Chinese dishes, ramen, and other delicious options. When you need to relax, you can unwind at cozy cafes and tea houses.

The Oyama ShÅtengai is not only a great place for shopping, but it also offers natural landscapes in the surrounding area. Take a leisurely stroll in the nearby parks and enjoy the beauty of changing seasons. Particularly famous is the

name: ã€2/Fã€‘Asakusabashi Building | for 6-8 ppl
description:
Our hostel is located in the heart of Tokyo, 5 minutes on foot from Asakusabashi Station, to Akihabara Station, with a large appliance mall "Yodobashi Camera" and the 24-hour "Don Quirande" department store, just a 15-minute walk away. There are many parking lots, supermarkets, convenience stores, restaurants, drugstores, 100yen shops near our apartment..... Then there is a large coin laundry shop 140 meters away from our apartment.It takes only 2 ~ 5 minutes to attractions such as Asakusa Red Gate, Sky Tree, Ueno by train, very convenient transportation.
Our apartment hotel is 5 floors high,
Each floor is a private floor passcode door door access.
Yes, there is no elevator.

neighborhood_overview:
4mins walk to Keisei Takasago sta. Can directly access to both Narita and Haneda Airport. Free pocket wifi/home wifi. This apartment is very conveniently located with many facilities and shops around such as convenience store, supermarket, post office, restaurants, laundromat, and so on.This is at perfect location for your Tokyo stay!!

*Sightseeing spots
*Taishakuten-Temple: Built in 1629 and famous as a temple of sculptures. The couple white snakes which are put around Water God holds golden Dragon-Ball.

*Yamamoto-Tei: Built in 1916 and has a pure Japanese garden which is ranked as the 4th in 900 Japanese gardens.

*Tora-san & Yoji Yamada Museum:
Tora-san is the most popular film series in Japan which is set in Shibamata area. In this museum, you can experience the good old Tokyo and the world of Yoji Yamada, Japanese famous movie director.

*Taishakuten-Temple Entrance Path: 200m long from Shibamata station to Taishakuten-Tem

neighborhood_overview:
It is a 5-minute walk to Tokyo Skytree.The Skytree is home to some of the city's most famous restaurants.
Geisha are still walking in the night in the old flower street near their home.This is the place where Fujisawa Shuhei's novel comes out.It is an area where a sky tree is formed and a new culture and an old culture coexist.If you walk a little, you can also stroll around Kanbara (Edo period spring shopping street).
Tokyo Sky Tree is a 5-minute walk away. Famous stores in Tokyo are gathered at Skytree.
Near my house is the old Hanamachi (Wining and dining), and geisha are still walking at night. This is the place that appears in the samurai novel. It is an area where new culture and old culture coexist.

About 1 hour by direct bus to Odaiba area
1 hour by direct bus to Tokyo Disneyland
Access to Shibuya, Shinjuku, Akihabara within 1 hour.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is full of amenities supermarkets, many convenience stores, coin laundry on the corner, and a public SPA (sento bath) also on the corner!
There are little bars in the neighborhood to try, or more extensive nightlife is very close to Shinjuku or Shibuya. Koenji is a very popular destination for people who like food and music. It is 14mins away by bus or 50mins on foot. Omotesando/Harajuku is also nearby which is a great shopping area. The unit's area offers an easy trip to many museums and galleries around Tokyo.
Also, the apartment is located right next to Little Okinawa, a small re-creation of the southern Okinawa islands. Take a stroll down the small pedestrian-friendly streets and try out all the Okinawan specialties being offered in the area. Whether it is Orion beer, artisan ice-cream, Okinawa style food, boutique vintage clothing stores, you are guaranteed to find something you like in this charming part of town. Okinawa people are notoriously friendly,

neighborhood_overview:
Located close to central Shinjuku area. 15-20 min walk to Shinjuku. Edge of Shin Okubo where it's known as Korean/Asian town in Tokyo. Lively streets with convenience stores, restaurants, grocery shops, supermarkets, etc. You can fully enjoy Tokyo from the hub!!

**************
- Matsumotokiyoshi pharmacy / Big chain pharmacy. 1 min from the house.
CVS / Lawson, Sunkus and 711. The closest one is Lawson. 1 min from the house.
- Supermarket Santoku. 2 min from the house
- Can Do 100 yen shop / Almost everything is sold for 100JPY plus tax. 5 min from the house.

**************

There are many restaurants and shopping. You donâ€™t have to worry about eating. And our house is very safe.

Dashan Shopping Street
Near the homestay is the famous Dashan commercial pedestrian street in Tokyo. It is headed by food stores. About 220 stores such as groceries, fashion, various services, etc., and you can experience the Japanese style of fireworks when you go out. It is very convenient for dining and shopping.

There are 2 lines. 2 min walk to Shin-egota Station on the Toei O-edo Line and 7 min walk to Egoda Station on the Seibu Ikebukuro Line.

neighborhood_overview: Ikebukuro station is one of the major hubs in Tokyo, with JR lines (Yamanote, Saikyo, and Shonan-Shinjuku), Tokyo Metro lines (Marunouchi, Yurakucho, and Fukutoshin), Tobu Line, and Seibu Line all coming in and out. The apartment itself is in a quiet neighborhood and it is hard to believe that it is right in the thick of mega-city Tokyo.

neighborhood_overview:
--------------------
Neighborhood
--------------------
Takeshita Dori: lined by many trendy shops, fashion boutiques, used clothes stores, crepe stands and fast food outlets geared towards the fashion.
Omotesando: a broad, tree lined avenue sometimes referred to as Tokyo's Champs-Elysees.
Meiji Jingu: one of Tokyo's major shrines, is located just west of the railway tracks in a large green oasis shared with the spacious Yoyogi Park.

view: Graffiti Apt / HTTH WiFi / Max 4pax / 2min to Sta.You can write anything on the wall! Spacious apartment for 4 people, this apartment is located only 2 minutes walk from Nishi-Chofu station (Keio line). Great location to visit Mount Takao or Ghibli museum. FREE Wi-fi is available!
neighborhood_overview:
++++++++ NEIGHBORHOOD INFORMATION ++++++++

We have lots of greens in the area!
Visit the following parks and attractions which is close to the apartment!
- Ghibli museum
- Jindaiji temple
- Chofu Airport
- Ajinomoto Stadium
- Inokashira Park
- Fuchu race course
- Jindai Botanical Park
- Musashino-mori Park

The Nishi-chofu Station is located 2 minute walk from the house. You can use the Keio Line to quickly get to the main spots in Tokyo.

The neighborhood is a quiet and relaxing area.

Chofu is one of the most convenient areas in Tokyo in terms of public transportation availability and cost.

Within 3 minute walk you can find supermarkets, convenience stores, many restaurants and shops.

The recommended restaurants are provided in the Welcome Guide.
________________________________________

name: The room of a quiet house with 3 cats
description:
Enjoy a home-like atmosphere with white diatomaceous walls and solid wood floors. Our energetic rescue cats, Roux, Kuro, and Ki-chan, might run around, so mind the cat hair.

Our daughter, born in June 2023, may cry at night or early morning, but guest rooms upstairs ensure a quiet sleep.
Host Kazuhiro, an ex-French chef, offers shared meals, drinks, and possibly fine wine. Cooking classes available on request.

For the interview article, search "Airbnb host story Kazuhiro site
.jp" on Google.

description: B &B located on the riverfront (a riverfront house located at the headwaters of the Akigawa Valley in Akiruno City, near Okutama. It will be covered with fresh green from April. Fireflies fly along the river from mid-June to early July. The room is in a good location, so you canread the  book, do barbecue , go fishing, lie down in a hammock at midnight and watch the starry sky. You can listen to the birdsong in the early morning and enjoy bird watching while taking a walk.

neighborhood_overview:
Located behind the National Gardens called Shinjuku Gyoen, and it's only a short walk to the park's entrance. The nearest station, Shinjuku-Gyoenmae station, is only 2 minute walk from our apartment, and you will find many small restanrants and convenience stores around.
It is also a walkable distance from the apartment to JR Shinjuku station (about 20 minute walk) and there are lots to see in between.
Our neighborhood is a perfect area for those who want a convenient and calm atmosphere of Tokyo, not a downtown.

neighborhood_overview:
My place is located in a residential area about a 12 minute walk from Iidabashi Station. There are many convenience stores, restaurants, supermarkets, and other stores in the surrounding area, making it very convenient for daily life.

The Iidabashi area is also famous as a tourist destination. Every spring, cherry blossoms bloom along the banks of the Kanda River, attracting many tourists from Japan and abroad who come to enjoy the beautiful scenery that symbolizes Japan.
Kagurazaka, a popular tourist spot famous for its stone pavement, is also within walking distance from my place. There are many unique stores, restaurants, and sweets stores that you will want to stop by.
Furthermore, the Tokyo Daijingu Shrine, said to be the most powerful matchmaking spot in Tokyo, and Tenzenkokuji Temple, which is said to be blessed with good fortune for warding off bad luck, good fortune, prosperous business, and financial fortune, are also close by.

neighborhood_overview:
A convenient store (7-Eleven) is located just 2 min walk away from our property.

Tokyo Skytree, the tallest tower in Japan (and 2nd tallest in the world), is a 5 min walk from the property. The nearest station is Oshiage (Skytree) station, which is a 7 min walk.

Surrounding Tokyo Skytree, is Skytree Town, an enormous complex that includes Sumida Aquarium, a Planetarium, and hundreds of restaurants, cafÃ©s, and shops.

Asakusa (Sensoji Temple) is 2 min away by train.

From Asakusa (2 min train ride), you can visit Nikko, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Oshiage (Skytree) Station also offers DIRECT train access to the key stations below:
Direct access to Asakusa: 2 min
Direct access to Nihonbashi: 9 min
Direct access to Otemachi: 14 min
Direct access to Higashi Ginza: 15 min
Direct access to Shibuya: 30 min

Oshiage (Skytree) Station is also near:
Ueno: 13 min
Akihabara: 15 min

neighborhood_overview:
This area has been a temple town since the Edo period, you can see a temple just behind the building, and you can find the temple on the old Edo map. Famous Kappa-dera is near here too. And now there are many local restaurants, convenience stores, supermarkets and temples around here. Japanese style casual tavern that local people loves so much, is 30 seconds walk from here. The nearest vegetable & fruits store is 30 seconds walk from here. Famous Kappa dera is 1 min walk and famous Kappabashi Dougu Street is 4 min from here. Still more, big shopping complex, Kimono rental, traditional shops, a large spa with Skytree view and other casual spas are all within 10 min walk.

There are many local events and traditional festivals too. Hatsumode in Jan, Setsubun in Feb, Cherry blossoms in March and April, many Matsuri in May and June, Tanabata and Fireworks in July, Summer Festival in Aug, many Aki-Matsuri in Sep and Oct, Torinoichi and Autumn leaves in Nov, Hagoita-ichi in Dec, an

Surrounding Tokyo Skytree, is Skytree Town, an enormous complex that includes Sumida Aquarium, a Planetarium, and hundreds of restaurants, cafÃ©s, and shops.

Asakusa (Sensoji Temple) is 2 min away by train.

neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in a quiet residential area 1 stops on the train from Ikebukuro Station. Around the Kanamecho station there is a nice local street with restaurants for eating in as well as 24hr convenience stores and a supermarket. In between the house and the station is a nice little park for relaxing and some more local restaurants.

Around Ikebukuro station is a very hustling and bustling city with lots big and small restaurants, bars and nightlife. As well as bigger shopping centers like PARCO and Sunshine City (which has a rooftop aquarium) there is Tokyo Metropolitan Theatre, one of Tokyoâ€™s larger theatre institutions.

From Ikebukuro it is easy to access all of Tokyo as itâ€™s one of Tokyoâ€™s main connecting train stations.

The Miyake Guest House features a typical Japanese home that was originally designed for two families. Guests will stay at a private, stand alone area with its own kitchen, bathroom and bedrooms. This space is available for full or shared rentals.

Great for groups/families staying in Tokyo long term in a quiet upscale neighborhood, or for somene wishing to experience local living. It's a 7-minute walk to the train station and 10-20 minutes to Kichijoji, Shibuya and Shinjuku.

description: My house is located in a residential area. It is very quiet even in a big city. You can walk to Yoyogi Park, Meiji Shrine and Harajuku from my house. JR Shinjuku station is the next stop by the express train. You can enjoy a quiet town different from the noisy city where many tourists visit. Also you can enjoy visiting small fashionable cafes and restaurants where locals go. There are four stations near my house Metro, Odakyu and Keio-Shin line. It is very convenient to go anywhere in Tokyo.

Cherry blossoms are blooming in the spring.

neighborhood_overview:
This area has been a temple town since the Edo period, you can see a temple just behind the building, and you can find the temple on the old Edo map. Famous Kappa-dera is near here too. And now there are many local restaurants, convenience stores, supermarkets and temples around here. Japanese style casual tavern that local people loves so much, is 30 seconds walk from here. The nearest vegetable & fruits store is 30 seconds walk from here. Famous Kappa dera is 1 min walk and famous Kappabashi Dougu Street is 4 min from here. Still more, big shopping complex, Kimono rental, traditional shops, a large spa with Skytree view and other casual spas are all within 10 min walk.

There are many local events and traditional festivals too. Hatsumode in Jan, Setsubun in Feb, Cherry blossoms in March and April, many Matsuri in May and June, Tanabata and Fireworks in July, Summer Festival in Aug, many Aki-Matsuri in Sep and Oct, Torinoichi and Autumn leaves in Nov, Hagoita-ichi in Dec, an

neighborhood_overview:
##RESTAURANTS & FOOD CHAINS##

**Accessible by foot**

-Sukiya (fast and cheap japanese food)
-Matsuya (same as Sukiya)
-Coco Curry (fast and cheap japanese curry)
-Mcdonald's (open 24hours)
-lots of small restaurants around

##COFFEE SHOPS##

-Starbucks (near Shinjuku Sanchome station)
-Doutor
-Caffe Veloce
-Tully's Coffee

##SHOPPING##

-Isetan (luxury brands)
-Don Quijote (japanese bazar)
-Marui (OIOI, japanese mall)
-Shinjuku Dori & Yasukuni Dori (shopping streets)

##TOURIST ATTRACTIONS NEARBY##

-Golden Gai (old bar area)
-Shinjuku Gyoen (nice park, entrance 200yens)
-Robot Restaurant
-Hanazono Shrine
-Tokyo Metropolitan Govt Building (nice view from top floor for free)

neighborhood_overview:
Located behind the National Gardens called Shinjuku Gyoen, and it's only a short walk to the park's entrance. The nearest station, Shinjuku-Gyoenmae station, is only 2 minute walk from our apartment, and you will find many small restanrants and convenience stores around.
It is also a walkable distance from the apartment to JR Shinjuku station (about 20 minute walk) and there are lots to see in between.
Our neighborhood is a perfect area for those who want a convenient and calm atmosphere of Tokyo, not a downtown.

neighborhood_overview:
Azabu-Juban is a lively residential area in central Tokyo with a mixture of Japanese shops, restaurants and bars. The convenience of several supermarkets in a central location and the proximity of Hiroo and Roppongi make it one of the more trendy and sought after residential areas of Tokyo. The main street, a block away from a busy road junction, has a village-like feel with cobbled stoned paving in some places. This atmosphere is created by the narrow streets, slow moving traffic, and a mixture of stores operated by older owners. Even the McDonald's has been carefully designed to be architecturally sympathetic.
It is known as Tokyo's most expensive upscale residential district; many artists, business people, and celebrities reside there. It is regarded as the gourmet capital of Tokyo, and being very central is ideal for exploring Tokyo, and at the end of the day to sit back, relax and enjoy the best of what the wonderful city of Tokyo has to provide.

neighborhood_overview:
A convenient store (7-Eleven) is located just 2 min walk away from our property.

Tokyo Skytree, the tallest tower in Japan (and 2nd tallest in the world), is a 5 min walk from the property. The nearest station is Oshiage (Skytree) station, which is a 7 min walk.

Surrounding Tokyo Skytree, is Skytree Town, an enormous complex that includes Sumida Aquarium, a Planetarium, and hundreds of restaurants, cafÃ©s, and shops.

Asakusa (Sensoji Temple) is 2 min away by train.

From Asakusa (2 min train ride), you can visit Nikko, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Oshiage (Skytree) Station also offers DIRECT train access to the key stations below:
Direct access to Asakusa: 2 min
Direct access to Nihonbashi: 9 min
Direct access to Otemachi: 14 min
Direct access to Higashi Ginza: 15 min
Direct access to Shibuya: 30 min

Oshiage (Skytree) Station is also near:
Ueno: 13 min
Akihabara: 15 min

description: My place is close to the city center, parks, art and culture, great views, and restaurants and dining. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the light, the comfy bed, and the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
view: Cozy & Comfortable Meguro Riverside StudioMy place is close to the city center, parks, art and culture, great views, and restaurants and dining. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the light, the comfy bed, and the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
neighborhood_overview:
Quietly residing just beyond the cityâ€™s inner circle, Meguro District attracts commuters, families, and artists who appreciate subtle charms over sonorous environs. Tokyoites tend to visit Meguro Districtâ€™s most famous local destinations, the hip enclave of Nakameguro and the canal along the Meguro River. Despite its far-away residential feel, Meguro District never seems out of touch. Organic cafes, famous izakayas, repurposed vintage shops, and musty must-see bookstores generate enough buzz to sustain this understatedly cool neighborhood.

During the cherry blossom season, the Meguro River has breathtaking views of the trees next to the river which is one of Tokyoâ€™s best areas to view. This has got to be one of the best experiences ever and a fantastic Instagram shot.

In the summertime, take a peaceful walk down the river and head south where you will encounter one of Tokyo's trendiest areas, Nakameguro, which has riverside bars, boutiques and restaurants.

neighborhood_overview:
From Shibuya, one of Tokyo's leading hot and exciting cities, it's just 2 stops by train (Denentoshi Line) (1 stop by express) and 3 minutes by train. It's nicknamed "Sangenjaya Station" and "Sancha", and is loved by many people because of its stylish cafes and second-hand clothing stores dotted around the modern Japanese cityscape.
My apato is a quiet residential area an 8-minute walk from the station.
Sangenjaya, which has a reputation for being an excellent place to live, is also very convenient for shopping. Most of the 5 supermarkets are open 24 hours, so you can get food and drinks with no problems, whether you come back late or arrive.
There are about 6 ~ 7 pharmacies in TAX-Free, and there are many convenience stores, and you can find them in a few minutes, and you can find them in a few minutes (there is a 24h bun in 1 minute from the apartment).

neighborhood_overview: Charming and quaint neighborhood tucked away peacefully next to the shopping and eating mecca of Shibuya. This location truly balances the convenience and access of Shibuya, with a tranquil, quiet neighborhood that provides the ultimate retreat after a day spent exploring the metropolis of Tokyo.

neighborhood_overview:
Good location 2 minutes from the station.Because it is a parking lot in front of you, there is a shrine just around the corner, so you can feel the atmosphere of Japan.
Nearby, there are convenience stores, supermarkets, and Daiso that you won't be able to shop for everyday necessities.
There are many restaurants and taverns, and it is also called Ramen Street, and there are many delicious ramen shops.
Beef bowl, soba shop, yakitori, yakiniku, sushi, bakery, Chinese, Indian curry, Thai, Korean, Italian, and other meals are very enjoyable.
In June, the flowers in the iris garden are beautifully blooming, so please stop by.

neighborhood_overview:
ã€œShinjukuã€œ
There are quite some famous department stores (Isetan/ Takashimaya/ LUMINE/ Marui/ Shinjuku Southern Terrace) where you can go shopping.
There is also Shinjuku Gyoen and Hanazono Shrine where you can experience the nature in the center of the city. If you want to go for a night out, there is Kabukicho where you will see a lot of Izakayaâ€™s (Typical Japanese â€œrestaurantsâ€) stores and host clubs.

ã€œShibuyaã€œ
For shopping, there is SHIBUYA109 (men and women dept are in separate buildings), a big shiny mall with over 100 boutiques that all show the latest looks in disposable fashion. Thereâ€™s also Shibuya Hikarie for an older and more refined consumer. Shibuya crossing is famous intersection outside Shibuya Station. If you want to experience nature and exercise a bit Yoyogi park is within 10min walking distance!

ã€œOmotesando/ Harajukuã€œ
Omotesando Hills is famous for shopping in the Omotesando area.
Takeshita street is always crowded

neighborhood_overview:
~Nearest stations~
ITABASHIHONCHOU for Mita line;4mins walk..........
There is a bus stop at this station that takes u to Ikebukuro station and Sunshine City(20mins);Akabane(15mins)etc

NAKAITABASHI for TobuTojo Line;12mins walk...................(URL HIDDEN)

The Shakuji River which is famous for the sakura viewing in Itabashi ward,is just a walking distance from Nakaitabashi station.During sakura season,more than 10,000trees of sakura will be in full bloom.Excellent place to view sakura and a fun cycling/jogging course along the river.
Sunshine City/Pocket Monster shop/Namja Town/Animation stores and cafes,restaurants.....all can be found in Ikebukuro,only 8mins by train. Want to try the hot spring in Tokyo without going far away?There is a hot spring/onsen spa nearby about 15mins by bike that is worth a visit. Tokyo Daibutsu,the 3rd biggest Buddha statue in Japan is just a few stations away

neighborhood_overview:
My place is located in a residential area about a 12 minute walk from Iidabashi Station. There are many convenience stores, restaurants, supermarkets, and other stores in the surrounding area, making it very convenient for daily life.

The Iidabashi area is also famous as a tourist destination. Every spring, cherry blossoms bloom along the banks of the Kanda River, attracting many tourists from Japan and abroad who come to enjoy the beautiful scenery that symbolizes Japan.
Kagurazaka, a popular tourist spot famous for its stone pavement, is also within walking distance from my place. There are many unique stores, restaurants, and sweets stores that you will want to stop by.
Furthermore, the Tokyo Daijingu Shrine, said to be the most powerful matchmaking spot in Tokyo, and Tenzenkokuji Temple, which is said to be blessed with good fortune for warding off bad luck, good fortune, prosperous business, and financial fortune, are also close by.

The house is also close to Ebisu (JR Yamanote train station), another trendy area. Also Roppongi, Harajuku, Shirokane, Nakameguro, Shibuya are all very easy to access either on foot or short ride on public transportation.

neighborhood_overview: Nishi-Ogikubo is a quiet, safe, and peaceful neighborhood where you almost forget you are only a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the big city of Tokyo. The town is well-known for its numerous antique shops, unique cafes, and secondhand book stores, providing entertainment for all generations. There are also some parks around the neighborhood such as Zenpukuji Park and Inokashira Park. They are both famous for cherry blossom viewing and their autumn leaves. Also, just a 10-minute walk from the station there is a shrine that is believed to be a spiritual place where you can gain benefits from a mystical force.

name: Contemporary Meguro Riverside Studio
description: My place is close to great views, restaurants and dining, art and culture, the city center, and parks. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the comfy bed, and the light. My place is good for couples and solo adventurers.
view: Contemporary Meguro Riverside StudioMy place is close to great views, restaurants and dining, art and culture, the city center, and parks. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the comfy bed, and the light. My place is good for couples and solo adventurers.
neighborhood_overview:
Quietly residing just beyond the cityâ€™s inner circle, Meguro District attracts commuters, families, and artists who appreciate subtle charms over sonorous environs. Tokyoites tend to visit Meguro Districtâ€™s most famous local destinations, the hip enclave of Nakameguro and the canal along the Meguro River. Despite its far-away residential feel, Meguro District never seems out of touch. Organic cafes, famous izakayas, repurposed vintage shops, and musty must-see bookstores generate enough buzz to sustain this understatedly cool neighborhood.

During the cherry blossom season, the Meguro River has breathtaking views of the trees next to the river which is one of Tokyoâ€™s best areas to view. This has got to be one of the best experiences ever and a fantastic Instagram shot.

In the summertime, take a peaceful walk down the river and head south where you will encounter one of Tokyo's trendiest areas, Nakameguro, which has riverside bars, boutiques and restaurants.
