neighborhood_overview: Nishi-Ogikubo is a quiet, safe, and peaceful neighborhood where you almost forget you are only a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the big city of Tokyo. The town is well-known for its numerous antique shops, unique cafes, and secondhand book stores, providing entertainment for all generations. There are also some parks around the neighborhood such as Zenpukuji Park and Inokashira Park. They are both famous for cherry blossom viewing and their autumn leaves. Also, just a 10-minute walk from the station there is a shrine that is believed to be a spiritual place where you can gain benefits from a mystical force.

neighborhood_overview:
Our place is located in the center area of Tokyo city , within walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Ginza and Akihabara (within 15-20min);near to the Bank of Japan, the Mitsukoshi Isetan department store, the Muromachi shopping center, etc., where you can buy Japanese souvenirs and enjoy Japanese food.
There are many subway routes in the area, including the JR line, the Ginza line, the Hanzomon line, the Hibiya line, the Asakusa line, and so on.
It is a 4-minutes walk from Mitsukoshimae Station ( Metro Ginza Line and Metro Hanzomon Line) , and a 4-minute walk from Kodenmacho Station ( Metro Hibiya Line).
It is also very convenient for visitors, who come and go to Narita and Haneda airports. There is a shuttle bus from the airport to Tokyo Station and this way ,currently, is the most comfortable, cheapest and fastest route. We are located just 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station .

neighborhood_overview:
This area has been a temple town since the Edo period, you can see a temple just behind the building, and you can find the temple on the old Edo map. Famous Kappa-dera is near here too. And now there are many local restaurants, convenience stores, supermarkets and temples around here. Japanese style casual tavern that local people loves so much, is 30 seconds walk from here. The nearest vegetable & fruits store is 30 seconds walk from here. Famous Kappa dera is 1 min walk and famous Kappabashi Dougu Street is 4 min from here. Still more, big shopping complex, Kimono rental, traditional shops, a large spa with Skytree view and other casual spas are all within 10 min walk.

There are many local events and traditional festivals too. Hatsumode in Jan, Setsubun in Feb, Cherry blossoms in March and April, many Matsuri in May and June, Tanabata and Fireworks in July, Summer Festival in Aug, many Aki-Matsuri in Sep and Oct, Torinoichi and Autumn leaves in Nov, Hagoita-ichi in Dec, an

name: SUMIRE AOI HOUSE - Minimal Japanese House
description:
"SUMIRE AOI HOUSE" is a small Japanese house.

The basic structure of the house was designed in 1952 by Makoto Masuzawa, a leading architect in Japan. And the house was redesigned by Makoto Koizumi in 1999. I had lived 20 years with my family.

The sense of space by the south-facing large windows and the stairwell, it will make you attracted. The area has some parks and fields, and it's leisurely.

I can introduce nearby shops.
Please spend your time like traveling daily life.

neighborhood_overview:
Our place is located in the center area of Tokyo city , within walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Ginza and Akihabara (within 15-20min);near to the Bank of Japan, the Mitsukoshi Isetan department store, the Muromachi shopping center, etc., where you can buy Japanese souvenirs and enjoy Japanese food.
There are many subway routes in the area, including the JR line, the Ginza line, the Hanzomon line, the Hibiya line, the Asakusa line, and so on.
It is a 4-minutes walk from Mitsukoshimae Station ( Metro Ginza Line and Metro Hanzomon Line) , and a 4-minute walk from Kodenmacho Station ( Metro Hibiya Line).
It is also very convenient for visitors, who come and go to Narita and Haneda airports. There is a shuttle bus from the airport to Tokyo Station and this way ,currently, is the most comfortable, cheapest and fastest route. We are located just 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station .

neighborhood_overview:
Our place is located in the center area of Tokyo city , within walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Ginza and Akihabara (within 15-20min);near to the Bank of Japan, the Mitsukoshi Isetan department store, the Muromachi shopping center, etc., where you can buy Japanese souvenirs and enjoy Japanese food.
There are many subway routes in the area, including the JR line, the Ginza line, the Hanzomon line, the Hibiya line, the Asakusa line, and so on.
It is a 4-minutes walk from Mitsukoshimae Station ( Metro Ginza Line and Metro Hanzomon Line) , and a 4-minute walk from Kodenmacho Station ( Metro Hibiya Line).
It is also very convenient for visitors, who come and go to Narita and Haneda airports. There is a shuttle bus from the airport to Tokyo Station and this way ,currently, is the most comfortable, cheapest and fastest route. We are located just 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station .

neighborhood_overview:
Our place is located in the center area of Tokyo city , within walking distance to the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Ginza and Akihabara (within 15-20min);near to the Bank of Japan, the Mitsukoshi Isetan department store, the Muromachi shopping center, etc., where you can buy Japanese souvenirs and enjoy Japanese food.
There are many subway routes in the area, including the JR line, the Ginza line, the Hanzomon line, the Hibiya line, the Asakusa line, and so on.
It is a 4-minutes walk from Mitsukoshimae Station ( Metro Ginza Line and Metro Hanzomon Line) , and a 4-minute walk from Kodenmacho Station ( Metro Hibiya Line).
It is also very convenient for visitors, who come and go to Narita and Haneda airports. There is a shuttle bus from the airport to Tokyo Station and this way ,currently, is the most comfortable, cheapest and fastest route. We are located just 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station .

name: Nishi-Ogikubo 2BR Type-A  2F
description:
This spacious apartment has a floor space of 64 square meters (689 square feet).
As you enter the apartment, you will find a dining table that comfortably seats 7 people at the center of the dining / kitchen space. Across from the dining space, there is a living room with a huge sofa and TV. There is a double bed in the master bedroom, and the second bedroom have two double bed. Wi-Fi is available in this apartment.
view:
Nishi-Ogikubo 2BR Type-A 2FThis spacious apartment has a floor space of 64 square meters (689 square feet).
As you enter the apartment, you will find a dining table that comfortably seats 7 people at the center of the dining / kitchen space. Across from the dining space, there is a living room with a huge sofa and TV. There is a double bed in the master bedroom, and the second bedroom have two double bed. Wi-Fi is available in this apartment.
neighborhood_overview: Nishi-Ogikubo is a quiet, safe, and peaceful neighborhood where you almost forget you are only a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the big city of Tokyo. The town is well-known for its numerous antique shops, unique cafes, and secondhand book stores, providing entertainment for all generations. There are also some parks around the neighborhood such as Zenpukuji Park and Inokashira Park. They are both famous for cherry blossom viewing and their autumn leaves. Also, just a 10-minute walk from the station there is a shrine that is believed to be a spiritual place where you can gain benefits from a mystical force.

The apartment is a 3-minute walk from JR Nishi Ogikubo station; a 24-hour supermarket is nearby.
view:
Nishi-Ogikubo 2BR Type-B 2FThis cozy 2BR apartment is furnished in soothing colors. The master bedroom has a double bed. The second bedroom has a 42" TV and a sofa (which can be converted into a wide double bed) .

The dining area has a dining table for four and a fully equipped kitchen. Wi-Fi is available in this apartment.
The apartment is a 3-minute walk from JR Nishi Ogikubo station; a 24-hour supermarket is nearby.
neighborhood_overview: Nishi-Ogikubo is a quiet, safe, and peaceful neighborhood where you almost forget you are only a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the big city of Tokyo. The town is well-known for its numerous antique shops, unique cafes, and secondhand book stores, providing entertainment for all generations. There are also some parks around the neighborhood such as Zenpukuji Park and Inokashira Park. They are both famous for cherry blossom viewing and their autumn leaves. Also, just a 10-minute walk from the station there is a shrine that is believed to be a spiritual place where you can gain benefits from a mystical force.

neighborhood_overview:
Located behind the National Gardens called Shinjuku Gyoen, and it's only a short walk to the park's entrance. The nearest station, Shinjuku-Gyoenmae station, is only 2 minute walk from our apartment, and you will find many small restanrants and convenience stores around.
It is also a walkable distance from the apartment to JR Shinjuku station (about 20 minute walk) and there are lots to see in between.
Our neighborhood is a perfect area for those who want a convenient and calm atmosphere of Tokyo, not a downtown.

neighborhood_overview:
***Local information
Takadanobaba is a town for university students, because there are a lot of universities.
That is why there are many reasonable local restaurants that would attract you if you would like to experience local atmosphere. Even if you walk 1km along the Waseda street between Takadanobaba station and Waseda station, you would be surprised by shops and restaurants standing in a low. On the other hand, there are still nostalgic houses in the back streets and nice shrines that make you feel Japanese daily life.

- Convenience store(24h) ... 2min
- Supermarket(24h) ... 4min
- Ramen shop ... 2min
- 100yen sushi restaurant ... 4min
- Starbucks ... 5min
- Pharmacy ... 2min
- Over 30 Ramen shops and various reasonable restaurants

name: Shinjuku 3LDK House, 10min to Isetan
description:
Our house is only 7-min walking distance from the nearest station, Shinjuku-Sanchome Station, and 10-min walking distance from Shinjuku Center!

Newly decorated 3LDK, located in a quiet area of Shinjuku, 7-min walk to the Shinjuku-Sanchome Station where is on the Subway Fukutoshin Line, Toei Shinjuku Line and Marunouchi Line. 10-min walk to Shinjuku City Shopping Mall Isetan, 0101 and other department stores. The location is great and so convenient for you to travel anywhere in Tokyo.

Newly decorated 3LDK, located in a quiet area of Shinjuku, 7-min walk to the Shinjuku-Sanchome Station where is on the Subway Fukutoshin Line, Toei Shinjuku Line and Marunouchi Line. 10-min walk to Shinjuku City Shopping Mall Isetan, 0101 and other department stores. neighborhood_overview:
Shinjuku is the center and transportation hub in Tokyo, known as major shopping area and nightlife. The central Shinjuku is in walking distance, but the house locates very quiet side near elementary school. Itâ€™s very safe and local.

- Maruetsu Supermarket (opens 24 hours) / 4-mins walk

- Daiso 100 Yen Shop/ 3-mins walk

- Family Mart Convenient Store / 3-mins walk

- Post Office Shinjuku Meijidori / 5 mins walk

- Artnia by Square Enix (Cafe) / 3-mins walk ** There are also many menus with motifs of popular games such as Dorakue and Final Fantasy with the goods section attached. **

No worries about eating and shopping, there are many restaurants and shopping malls nearby. Kabukicho nightlife area is in walking distance as well. The house location is very safe and quiet!

name: ASAKUSA-Triplex(2-4F)+terrace with City View
description:
The property occupies 2nd, 3rd, 4th floor of the building.
2nd floor: kitchen, dining, toilet, bathroom. 3rd floor: bedroom (bunk bed x 2, single bed x 1 of 97cm width 197 cm length), toilet. 4th floor: small room with sofa bed of semi double size (120cm width) Ideal for a small group or a family. Due to steep stairs, the property is not recomended for elders or small children. Modern interior design including modern arts.

neighborhood_overview:
Primary school (Fuji shogakko), Asakusa Police Station are a minute away
Kenban (Geisha Union Office) is 3-minute away
4-5 min: Senzoku Shopping Street (supermarkets, pharmacy, 100 yen shop, sundry goods, laundry shop, flower shop, public bath (Tatsumiyu, Tsurunoyu), various hidden bars and restaurants, Sensoji Temple and Asakusa Shrine)
9-minute away: Tsukuba Express Asakusa Station (to go to Akihabara)
10-minute away: Matsuya Dept Store, Asakusa Station (Tobu Line to go to Nikko, Ginza Line)
12-minute away: Toei Asakusa Station (Haneda and Narita Airport), Kappabashi Street (unique street where everything for opening a restaurant or coffee shop can be obtained here including sharp knives, sample food sample for display)
30-minute away: Ueno Station, Ameyoko, Tokyo Skytree (walking)

description:
A home built in 2017 just 4 minutes walk from Ikebukuro Station ( JR Yamanote line and 3 subways lines). 3 minute walk from the Limousine Bus Station(Metropolitan Hotel station) for both Haneda Airport and Narita Airport. In house unlimited wifi. 2 pocket Wifi.

view:
HOUSE, 2 pocket Wifi, 4 min walk to Ikebukuro StatA home built in 2017 just 4 minutes walk from Ikebukuro Station ( JR Yamanote line and 3 subways lines). 3 minute walk from the Limousine Bus Station(Metropolitan Hotel station) for both Haneda Airport and Narita Airport. In house unlimited wifi. 2 pocket Wifi.
1 parking spot is available during most of the year, please let us know if you are interested in using the parking spot.
neighborhood_overview: Ikebukuro is famous for the Sunshine city mall, and is a hub for Japanese pop culture fans that is only second to Akihabara. There are a wide variety of shops and restaurants around, and there is a convenience store just 2 minutes from the property. A supermarket and department store are inside of the station. There is a beautiful Sakura tree that can be seen in the spring just a 1 minute walk from the house (seen in our listing photographs).

neighborhood_overview: The name "Jujo" comes from the name of a traditional Japanese measurement of land area. The original shopping district was built in 1938, and since then it has been getting bigger and bigger. Now it is one of the three big Tokyo Ginza districts. There are over 200 shops in Jujo Ginza, Fushimi Ginza and other shopping areas around Jujo Station.

From Shibuya, one of Tokyo's leading hot and exciting cities, it's just 2 stops by train (Denentoshi Line) (1 stop by express) and 3 minutes by train. It's nicknamed "Sangenjaya Station" and "Sancha", and is loved by many people because of its stylish cafes and second-hand clothing stores dotted around the modern Japanese cityscape.
My apato is a quiet residential area an 8-minute walk from the station.
Sangenjaya, which has a reputation for being an excellent place to live, is also very convenient for shopping. Most of the 5 supermarkets are open 24 hours, so you can get food and drinks with no problems, whether you come back late or arrive.
There are about 6 ~ 7 pharmacies in TAX-Free, and there are many convenience stores, and you can find them in a few minutes, and you can find them in a few minutes (there is a 24h bun in 1 minute from the apartment).

neighborhood_overview:
My place is located in a residential area about a 12 minute walk from Iidabashi Station. There are many convenience stores, restaurants, supermarkets, and other stores in the surrounding area, making it very convenient for daily life.

The Iidabashi area is also famous as a tourist destination. Every spring, cherry blossoms bloom along the banks of the Kanda River, attracting many tourists from Japan and abroad who come to enjoy the beautiful scenery that symbolizes Japan.
Kagurazaka, a popular tourist spot famous for its stone pavement, is also within walking distance from my place. There are many unique stores, restaurants, and sweets stores that you will want to stop by.
Furthermore, the Tokyo Daijingu Shrine, said to be the most powerful matchmaking spot in Tokyo, and Tenzenkokuji Temple, which is said to be blessed with good fortune for warding off bad luck, good fortune, prosperous business, and financial fortune, are also close by.

They have everything at this place, from alcohol to groceries, toiletries to amusement items, all at prices much lower than other retail shops.

neighborhood_overview:
This area of Shinjuku (FunaMachi and Yotsuya) is very convenient for getting around Tokyo, while also being a great, safe, and interesting area in which to stay. You also have easy and quick access to all the other great Tokyo areas - such as Shinjuku City, Shibuya, Harajuku, Shimokitazawa, Kabukicho, Odaiba, Akihabara, Ginza, and so on. Please take a look at the maps in our listing's pictures section for more details, and also read the reviews from our previous guests.

Very close nearby (a 4 minute walk) there is ARAKICHO. An area with narrow and quiet streets. There you will discover many famous restaurants, as well as lots of interesting little Izakaya (casual drinking places that serve a variety of small dishes, such as Robata [grilled food], Yakitori, Salads and other Finger Food), and small Yakitori-Ya restaurants that grill Yakitori (chicken and other things on wood skewers) to order over charcoal, to be consumed while drinking beer or shÅchÅ« (a Japanese traditional

name: 2+ BDRM Shinjuku residential / WFH
description:
Comfortable, licensed 2+ bedroom in a residential neighborhood in Shinjuku.
Quiet, safe area. Walking distance to several train stations, as well as many popular sights. Strong Wifi, 2 keys, 2 pocket Wifi, comfortable beds, and lots of space for you to feel at home in!

*For TRANSPORT, and walking times, click "Location" and "Getting Aroundâ€
view:
2+ BDRM Shinjuku residential / WFHComfortable, licensed 2+ bedroom in a residential neighborhood in Shinjuku.
Quiet, safe area. Walking distance to several train stations, as well as many popular sights. Strong Wifi, 2 keys, 2 pocket Wifi, comfortable beds, and lots of space for you to feel at home in!

neighborhood_overview:
For details on train stations / walking times read the "Getting Around" section.

Many popular sights in Shinjuku -- such as Golden Gai, Kabukicho, Memory Lane (aka 'Piss Alley'), Shin Okubo's Korea Town, the Metropolitan Govt. Building, and the Park Hyatt (the bar from the movie LOST IN TRANSLATION) can be reached on foot (within 20 minutes) - or easily, and within minutes, by taxi.

The apartment is in a *residential* area with many families, giving you a feel for what it's like to live in Tokyo. The vibrant west Shinjuku skyscraper district is in the background and a few minutes walk away. There are some local restaurants nearby and countless more on the way to the train stations - at ground level, in basements, and in skyscrapers. There are two grocery stores a few minutes walk, and there is a convenience store just around the corner.

name: Shinagawa Matcha Place 12 mins walk to The station
description:
Quiet and cozy one bedroom apartment in Shinagawa - a central hub for getting around Japan with bullet train at your door and direct connection to both Haneada and Narita airports. Sightseeing Travelers love the convenience of Shinagawa station, only minutes from most major centers in Tokyo on the Yamanote Line - no need to transfer if headed to Shibuya, Shinjuku, Ueno or Asakusa.

Please book with the listing below for Sept to Nov. it is the same apartment.
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/25899252

neighborhood_overview:
Shinagawa station is itself bustling with specialty food shops, bookstore, Starbucks and other cafes, clothing and gifts stores to explore before you even leave the station! On the east side of the station (Kounan exit) you'll find a Dean and Deluca bakery cafe inside Queen's Isetan, Sunday market stalls, sushi restaurant, and many local restaurants serving noodles, rice bowls and other delights.

Sip coffee from the cafes on the Takanawa Exit (west). Grab some bento's or ready-made sides for a Japanese dinner from the basement floor of Keikyu-store supermarket or Kinokuniya on your way home.

There is an aquarium and a movie theatre in Shinagawa prince hotel.

Our apartment is located in quiet housing and leafy Takanawa, with two temples located close by. Plenty of room to kick a soccer ball in the children's park that also has swings, slides and a stepping stone pond.

Taking a stroll up the hill you will pass another temple and find 24hr con

neighborhood_overview:
â˜…Surrounding Areaâ˜…
Just a 7-minute walk from Keisei-Hikifune Station, Grape Row House in Kyojima offers an open-air bath with a view of the Skytree.
Please enjoy a blissful moment in the unique open-air bath with a view of Skytree.
With a 60-minute train ride from the airport and 40 minutes from major train stations and tourist attractions, it is a convenient base for sightseeing or business travel in the city.
The Kyojima area is a town with an old-fashioned atmosphere that escaped air raids during the war.You can experience the intricate alleys of Japan and feel the life of old town residents in the "Kirakira Tachibana Shopping Street" where the nostalgic life continues.

name: 4 minutes walk from Nishi Shinjuku Station AS04
description: DoMo Nishi-Shinjuku is a elevator apartment in a quiet alley. It is close to the prime location of Shinjuku City Hall. The subway exit is surrounded by five-star hotels and there are many cafes and restaurants. The nearby streets are full of urban and lively styles. After getting off the tram or limousine bus, you can walk to DoMo within ten minutes, and you can reach DoMo Hometel A by turning into the alley in two minutes from the subway Nishi-Shinjuku Station exit.
view: 4 minutes walk from Nishi Shinjuku Station AS04DoMo Nishi-Shinjuku is a elevator apartment in a quiet alley. It is close to the prime location of Shinjuku City Hall. The subway exit is surrounded by five-star hotels and there are many cafes and restaurants. The nearby streets are full of urban and lively styles. After getting off the tram or limousine bus, you can walk to DoMo within ten minutes, and you can reach DoMo Hometel A by turning into the alley in two minutes from the subway Nishi-Shinjuku Station exit.
neighborhood_overview:
DoMo is very close to downtown Shinjuku, only about ten minutes walk. Therefore, the life and entertainment functions are very complete. We usually like to go shopping nearby. It is fun and easy to go shopping. You will definitely like it!

supermarket
There are well-stocked supermarkets nearby and very close to our room. It's only a four-minute walk to get there, which is very convenient for buying vegetables and cooking by yourself.

24-hour convenience store
There are several non-closing convenience stores less than five minutes away

Restaurant/Ramen/Bar/Izakaya/Cafe
You can find food from all walks of life in the Nishi Shinjuku area. Italian, French, Chinese, Korean, Thai, etc., and of course Japanese! If you are a ramen lover, there are many ramen shops within walking distance of our listing!

I hope to help you during stay in Japan!

The Water Tower was built in 1923 and has become a landmark of Sakurashimmachi.
A few times a year, it is lighted up.

name: Modern 3-Bedroom 80m2 Apartment near Shibuya!
description:
Welcome to our Home! This beautiful apartment is a fully independent spacious 3 bedroom 80m2 apartment on the 1st floor of our family home.

Conveniently located in a quiet residential area, but just 5 minutes walk from the lively hustle-and bustle of Sangenjaya, this is the perfect location and size for families or groups.

Our apartment is fully furnished and was built in December 2016 - it is a great Western-style modern apartment with a twist of Japanese!
view:
Modern 3-Bedroom 80m2 Apartment near Shibuya!Welcome to our Home! This beautiful apartment is a fully independent spacious 3 bedroom 80m2 apartment on the 1st floor of our family home.

Conveniently located in a quiet residential area, but just 5 minutes walk from the lively hustle-and bustle of Sangenjaya, this is the perfect location and size for families or groups.

Our apartment is fully furnished and was built in December 2016 - it is a great Western-style modern apartment with a twist of Japanese!
neighborhood_overview:
Sangenjaya is a really cool neighbourhood...which is exactly why we chose to live here!!

It is close enough to all the main commercial spots, yet really has its own distinctive vibe and character. It has the perfect blend, combining an abundance of Japanese/Western restaurants and bars, with all the extra ammenities you need for a comfortable stay (several large supermarkets nearby), shops, gym, park for kids, car and cycle rental etc.

In the neighborhood, there is an unlimited number of restaurants ranging from Japanese restaurants such as ramen, gyoza, okonomiyaki, yakiniku, sushi, izakaya and soba. If you miss a bit of foreign cuisine, there are some great restaurants nearby including Italian, Spanish, Mexican, Indian, Korean, Chinese.

Really the choices are unlimited, and Sangenjaya is just a great area to go for a stroll and pop in to some authentic restaurants and coffee shops. We have lived in Sangenjaya for 3 years and still have so much to disc

name: 4 minutes walk from Nishi Shinjuku Station AS03
description: DoMo Nishi-Shinjuku is a elevator apartment in a quiet alley. It is close to the prime location of Shinjuku City Hall. The subway exit is surrounded by five-star hotels and there are many cafes and restaurants. The nearby streets are full of urban and lively styles. After getting off the tram or limousine bus, you can walk to DoMo within ten minutes, and you can reach DoMo Hometel A by turning into the alley in two minutes from the subway Nishi-Shinjuku Station exit.
view: 4 minutes walk from Nishi Shinjuku Station AS03DoMo Nishi-Shinjuku is a elevator apartment in a quiet alley. It is close to the prime location of Shinjuku City Hall. The subway exit is surrounded by five-star hotels and there are many cafes and restaurants. The nearby streets are full of urban and lively styles. After getting off the tram or limousine bus, you can walk to DoMo within ten minutes, and you can reach DoMo Hometel A by turning into the alley in two minutes from the subway Nishi-Shinjuku Station exit.
neighborhood_overview:
DoMo is very close to downtown Shinjuku, only about ten minutes walk. Therefore, the life and entertainment functions are very complete. We usually like to go shopping nearby. It is fun and easy to go shopping. You will definitely like it!

supermarket
There are well-stocked supermarkets nearby and very close to our room. It's only a four-minute walk to get there, which is very convenient for buying vegetables and cooking by yourself.

24-hour convenience store
There are several non-closing convenience stores less than five minutes away

Restaurant/Ramen/Bar/Izakaya/Cafe
You can find food from all walks of life in the Nishi Shinjuku area. Italian, French, Chinese, Korean, Thai, etc., and of course Japanese! If you are a ramen lover, there are many ramen shops within walking distance of our listing!

description:
[Shibuya Star] is the name of our inn, located in Honmachi, Shibuya-ku.It is a 3-storey single-family house.We provide 2nd floor, 3rd floor and top floor for your exclusive use. 2nd floor has living room, kitchen, tatami room; 3rd floor is bedroom.Each floor has two toilets and one bathroom.Toilets and bathrooms are separate, so even large groups can cope easily.
It takes about 4 minutes on foot from Nishi-Shinjuku-Gochome station to our house.From here to Shinjuku can be reached directly by subway 2 stops in 4 minutes, or if you want to exercise, you can also walk to Shinjuku in 20 minutes.
Although it is located in a quiet residential area, it is also very convenient to be surrounded by restaurants, convenience stores, drug stores and supermarket life.

name: [Free WiFi] 4BR Cozy/Big 105sqm Cond in Ikebukuro
description:
ã€Cozy Tokyo City Stayã€‘

Newly built 3-story designer interior in Ikebukuro area

Cozy Stay, a great choice for a great Tokyo trip.
5 min walk from Tokyo Metro Yurakucho Line/Fukutoshin Kanemachi station.
It is a 15-minute walk from the west exit of Ikebukuro Station or 5 minutes by taxi by 1 meter.

With the latest facilities, a spacious living room, a beautiful modern bath, and a number of 4 rooms, you can rest assured even if you are traveling with a group or family.

Ikebukuro Station is a very convenient place with JR Yamanote Line, Fukutoshin Line, Seibu Ikebukuro Line, Marunouchi Line, JR Saikyo Line, Toho Toho Line, Yuracho Line, etc.
The neighborhood is Yonemachi's Ebisu Street, and there are plenty of shops where you can eat and shop.

Experience the charm and comfort of Tokyo at Cozy Stay Kanmachi!

description: Our latest 1 bedroom with two beds is fully furnished with brand-new furniture, clean and well equipped with modern amenities. This 35-square-meter apartment features a full kitchen and a bathroom with bathtub.
view: Nishi-Ogikubo 1BR Twin Type-C  3FOur latest 1 bedroom with two beds is fully furnished with brand-new furniture, clean and well equipped with modern amenities. This 35-square-meter apartment features a full kitchen and a bathroom with bathtub.
neighborhood_overview: Nishi-Ogikubo is a quiet, safe, and peaceful neighborhood where you almost forget you are only a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the big city of Tokyo. The town is well-known for its numerous antique shops, unique cafes, and secondhand book stores, providing entertainment for all generations. There are also some parks around the neighborhood such as Zenpukuji Park and Inokashira Park. They are both famous for cherry blossom viewing and their autumn leaves. Also, just a 10-minute walk from the station there is a shrine that is believed to be a spiritual place where you can gain benefits from a mystical force.

description: The place is close to beautiful park called Hikarigaoka park.In the autumn season you may enjoy beautiful fallen leaves and in the spring there is also outstanding cherry blossom that you may take a nice walk.  This place also has relatively good access to the main areas of Tokyo like Shinjuku or Ikebukuro or Shibuya. We have 3 train stations nearby in around 10-15 mins walking distance. To those main areas I have mentioned above, you may reach in 30 mins by train.

name: #201_One station to Ikebukuro
description:
Our homestay is located at Shimitabashi Station, which is a five-minute walk from the commercial district Ikebukuro (about three minutes).There is a Lawson convenience store in three minutes on foot, a post office, a 7-Eleven convenience store, a family mart, a large supermarket, a yakiniku shop, Matsumoto Kiyoshi, etc.Ten minutes on foot is Itabashi Station (JR's Sakikyo Line), which goes directly to Ikebukuro, Shinjuku, Shibuya, and Odaiba.Ten minutes walk is Shintanabashi Station, which can take the Mita Line directly to Houpark, Tokyo Tower and Ginza.

The first floor of our homestay is the living room with one bedroom, one toilet, and one bathroom.2nd floor has 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom.

Narita Airport: Take the Keisei Line (or skyline) to Nippori Station, change to the JR Yamanote Line to Ikebukuro Station, and change to Tobu Too Line to Shimitabashi Station. Haneda Airport: Take the Keikyu Line to Shinagawa, change to JR Yamanote Line to Ikebukuro Station, and

neighborhood_overview:
ï¿­AREAï¿­
With fashionable tall commercial buildings standing on both sides of the road, there are some green places like Akasaka Imperial Palace around Aoyama Itchome station. Also, you can buy daily commodities at a supermarket just in front of the station. It seems that it has everything a high living quality environment needs. It takes only 11 minutes to Meiji Jingu Gaien by foot.

Aoyama Itchome Station has 3 railway lines, therefore access to sightseeing spots is excellent! If you use the Oedo Line, you can easily go to the Warner Bros. Studio Tour Tokyo â€“ The Making of Harry Potter, also known as Harry Potter Studio. Azabudai Hills, a popular tourist spot, is about 10 minutes away by taxi, allowing you to fully enjoy the new facilities of Tokyo.

A convenience store and supermarket are just 3 minutes away from listing! It is extremely convenient for foreign guests if you need to buy something even in the middle of the night. Staying at a residence street

name: Close to IKEBUKURO * Good location
description:
Our homestay is located at Shimitabashi Station, which is a five-minute walk from the commercial district Ikebukuro.There is a Lawson convenience store in three minutes on foot, a post office, a 7-Eleven convenience store, a family mart, a large supermarket, a yakiniku shop, Matsumoto Kiyoshi, etc.Ten minutes walk is Itabashi Station (JR's Saki Kyo Line), direct to Ikebukuro, Shinjuku, Shibuya, Odaiba.Ten minutes walk is Shintanabashi Station, which can take the Mita Line directly to Houpark, Tokyo Tower and Ginza.

On the first floor of our homestay is the living room, there is one bedroom (two sets of bunk mattresses), one toilet, one bathroom (shower room, no bathtub).On the second floor there are two bedrooms (each room has two single beds), one restroom.

Narita Airport: Take the Keisei Line (or skyline) to Nippori Station, change to the JR Yamanote Line to Ikebukuro Station, and change to Tobu Too Line to Shimitabashi Station. Haneda Airport: Take the Keikyu

The closest underground station is Shinjuku-sanchome Station (æ–°å®¿ä¸‰ä¸ç›®), which has lies on the Tokyo Metro Marunouchi and the Toei Shinjuku Lines in Shinjuku Ward of Tokyo. It is located just south-east of Shinjuku Station and is connected to it by an underground passageway and a shopping mall. Directly above Shinjuku-sanchome subway station is Isetan Department Store , one of the most famous department stores in Tokyo. Prices at Isetan range from medium to high. The basement floor is the food hall with a large array of different food counters.

neighborhood_overview: Akihabara is the hub of Japanese anime culture and technology. You will find many stores specializing in toys, trading cards, and collectibles. This area is also known as the world's leading electronics town.  You can buy high-quality Japanese products for a reasonable price. Many items are made to be used globally. From Akihabara, you can also reach at Asakusa and Ryogoku by a 15 minute train ride.

neighborhood_overview:
Quietly residing just beyond the cityâ€™s inner circle, Meguro District attracts commuters, families, and artists who appreciate subtle charms over sonorous environs. Tokyoites tend to visit Meguro Districtâ€™s most famous local destinations, the hip enclave of Nakameguro and the canal along the Meguro River. Despite its far-away residential feel, Meguro District never seems out of touch. Organic cafes, famous izakayas, repurposed vintage shops, and musty must-see bookstores generate enough buzz to sustain this understatedly cool neighborhood.

During the cherry blossom season, the Meguro River has breathtaking views of the trees next to the river which is one of Tokyoâ€™s best areas to view. This has got to be one of the best experiences ever and a fantastic Instagram shot.

In the summertime, take a peaceful walk down the river and head south where you will encounter one of Tokyo's trendiest areas, Nakameguro, which has riverside bars, boutiques and restaurants.

There are many small bars and local restaurants, with supermarkets and convenience stores open at all hours, too. You never get bored spending time in Takadanobaba:)!

Little Japan is in "Shitamachi," the Old Town area, surrounded by Tokyo's signature places such as Asakusa, Akihabara and Ryogoku.

The nearest train station is "Asakusabashi" of JR or TOEI Subway, which can be accessed directly from Haneda Airport (HND) and Narita Airport (NRT) without any transfer.

It is also close to Tokyo Station, thus can be your home base to travel all over Japan.
